Title: CIB QR - Risk Quantitative Research, Equity Derivatives Modelling Vice President / Executive Director
Job_Description:
J.P. Morgans Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services. The worlds most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. With nearly $20 trillion of assets under custody, the Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.

The primary aim of this team is to research and develop quantitative models for the Equity Derivatives business, as well as to ensure their compliance with internal policies and industry regulations. This involves:
Developing models for the pricing and risk management of equity derivatives, including investigating improvements to existing models
Implementing these models in our quant library
Writing model documentation compliant with internal and regulatory standards
Working with model control teams to facilitate timely and efficient review and approval of models
Liaising with business functions as well as other quantitative research and control teams
Qualifications/Experience:
Outstanding academic record with a PhD or Masters Degree in a quantitative discipline from a top-tier institution
At least five years of relevant desk quant experience in Equity Derivatives or related asset classes
Previous experience in model review and validation
A thorough understanding of equity derivatives pricing theory and standard models
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong coding skills
Professional C++/Python development experience desirable

Title: Quantitative Research - M/F VIE
Job_Description:
Environment

Your environment
SG CIB is the Corporate and Investment Banking arm of the Societe Generale Group. Present in over 50 countries across Europe, the Americas and Asia. SG CIB provides corporate, financial institutions, investors and public sector clients with value-added integrated financial solutions.
At Societe Generale, you will be joining the Global Markets division (MARK) of SG Corporate and Investment Banking. MARK offers a cross-asset approach along all its offerings : Research, Investment & Risk Management Solutions, Execution and Prime Services to asset managers, pension funds, companies, private banks, insurance companies, hedge funds, family offices, sovereign funds and distributors worldwide.

As a Quantitative Researcher in the Asia QMM team (quantitative market-making), you will be trained by senior quants to research and test systematic trading strategies. You will learn how to apply your mathematical / statistical skills to this growing field of financial markets.

Mission
Your role

Your main responsibilities and missions will be :

Identify, record, clean and validate structured and unstructured datasets as a source of information
Research alphas: design, model and test predictive statistical models
Work on risk management, risk / reward optimization and risk constraints
Develop code of trading models to run backtests on statistical market-making strategies with holding horizons from intraday to weeks

The VIE assignment in a nutshell

This VIE in Hong Kong is to begin as soon as possible but you need to plan 3 months between your application date and the beginning of your VIE assignment. It will last 12 months.

The VIE is a specific contract, under Business France's eligibility criteria, opened to candidates under 28 and from the member states of the European Economic Space. For further information, please see www.civiweb.com.

Profile
Your profile

You are graduated with a Master degree from Engineering or Business School or University with a secialization in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or similar.

Prior experience in data-driven quantitative research will be an advantage.

You are fluent in English.

You are proficient in Microsoft Office application (Excel, powerpoint).

Object oriented languages (with a preference for C#) and Statistical / analytics programming languages (with a preference for R) are required.

Evolution
Your Career Path

You may have the opportunity to join Societe Generale group permanently after your VIE mission, according to opportunities, without going through the whole recruitment process again.

To facilitate the examination of your application by our English-speaking managers, we thank you for applying in English.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Business Integrity Associate, Data Analytics, Greater China
Job_Description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities we're just getting started.Business Integrity's mission is to ensure safe and trusted connections between people, businesses, and Facebook. Our team works together to anticipate and predict potential threats to our platform, design and build tools to protect against these threats, and then implement and enforce these systems at scale. We leverage data analysis, machine learning and a robust infrastructure to review the quality of promoted content on our platform. We partner closely with several cross-functional teams, including product, engineering, and data science, to ensure high quality and safe experiences for both people and businesses across the Facebook family of apps.

Successful candidates for this team are adaptable, creative, have a bias toward action, aren't afraid of being wrong, and can successfully work across various teams & countries. Opportunities are available in Hong Kong

Responsibilities:
Develop compelling analyses to execute data-informed initiatives that helps improve our support channels, improve the quality of our ad products and drive great service
Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and data visualization to see beyond the numbers and pull insights to help identify trends & opportunities to drive growth of our product & business
Be a thought leader for data-informed initiatives and guide the teams direction overall
Conduct in-depth investigations leveraging large and complex data sets
Partner with Data Science, Product and Engineering teams to solve problems at scale
Inform, influence, and execute new strategies and tactics using analysis and impact metrics to support your positions
Mininum Qualifications:
BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Math/Finance, Physics, Economics, Statistics or other technical discipline with professional experience in a quantitative field
8+ years of work experience in a role involving analytical initiatives (ie: business intelligence, data analytics or technical systems)
Experience with SQL
Experience with reporting systems and data pipeline architecture
Experience leveraging data to make decisions and solve problems
Experience resolving, communicating, and presenting issues & insights to both technical and non-technical audiences
Critical thinking and problem solving experience in a professional setting
Ability to assess, analyze and resolve complicated issues, and distill that complexity into simple and concise communication
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working and communicating with global teams
Experience with statistical analysis, and a statistical package such as R, MATLAB, SPSS, SAS, or Stata
Development experience in at least one scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl)
Advanced technical degree

Title: Project Manager (Analytics and Decisioning Services)
Job_Description:
Dynamics of the Role

This position is a combined roles of a Project Manager and Business Analyst. As a PM, its major responsibilities include project management, customer engagement, leadership and leading projects with diverse teams to deliver a solution to TransUnion customer. This position will lead and manage multiple concurrent projects, coordinating work across variety of internal TransUnion groups as well as external vendors and/or consultants, and providing appropriate communication to all project stakeholders (internal and external) to ensure successful project completion and/or compliance of Service Level Agreements (SLA). As a Business Analyst, he will be responsible in eliciting and documenting the requirements.

This position will recommend project structure and processes, especially on new product roll-outs or enhancements to existing products, to meet new and challenging business needs using advanced project management skills and a variety of project methodologies and techniques. It will also be responsible for maintaining relationships with external customers and sales personnel throughout the duration of the project to facilitate transparency on project status and risks. Being exposed to a domain, the role is expected to also provide an adequate level of being expert on the solution to carry out conversation with customers during requirements gathering and troubleshooting of issues.

How You'll Contribute
Apply in-depth professional experience and broad knowledge of both business and technology to analyze and develop integrated solutions to resolve simple to complex technical or business issues. Lead and actively participate and interact with customers to understand business needs, identify the best solution, and design the processes to meet the needs.
Project Management.Lead IT projects by directing, driving and overseeing the work done by its project team/s across the phases of SDLC using TransUnion implementation methodology and standard processes to ensure successful project delivery. The scope of the work includes project administration, issue resolution and escalating them when necessary, managing project budgets and estimates, and ensuring that project communication exceeds stakeholder needs using expert skills in meeting leading, presentations and problem solving.
Interface with both Project Steering Committee and TransUnion senior management on all escalated project related issues, changes in scope, project risks and project status. Ensure that comprehensive information is provided to all stakeholders in a timely manner. Work with other teams to prioritize project work.
Ensure that standard project processes are followed each project so that changes to project scope, requirements, resources, functionality and risk are monitored, documented and communicated to all project stakeholders in a timely manner.
Propose improvement to existing processes to make the work of the team efficient.
Requirements Elicitation. Using multiple information gathering techniques, lead and conduct facilitated sessions with customers to define detailed business requirements for solution development.
Analyzing Requirements. Establish and maintain clear scope boundaries for the solution. Develop clear and concise functional requirements for the technical developers that are free from ambiguity to minimize re-work and errors. Articulate to the clients the implications of implementing new technologies in the current business and technology framework. Recognize the business's needs and the implications of change. Formulate alternative solutions to satisfy business requirements.
Specifying Requirements. Validate and/or develop precise documentation of prioritized functional requirements/configuration document or user stories that can be shared with various stakeholders and in a format that can be directly converted to test plans, use cases, and/or system conceptual designs to meet performance targets and development project plans. Discuss these requirements gathered to the architect and/or development team, ensuring there is a clear and concise understanding of requirements.
Validating and Verifying Requirements. Validate and/or maintain a traceability matrix that links the business requirements to technical solution, and from solution to test cases and vice-versa, to ensure that all captured business requirements signed-off by the customer is delivered and tested in the solution. Work with QA team to ensure that appropriate test plan and relevant test cases are prepared for Systems Integration Testing or User Acceptance Testing and that these are aligned to the signed-off requirements. Review test conditions and expected results for product, performance and user acceptance testing.
Configuration. Perform simple/non-routinary to complex/critical configurations of standard/out of the box DE solutions.
Documentation. Review and/or write/develop all required documentation for the project such as but not limited to User Manual, Training Manual, Requirements Document, Process flows.
Training. Train customer's Core Project Team, End-User, Operation Support or other relevant users on the use of the proposed solution.
Participate in quality management reviews as outlined in the project work plan, and in reviews of the designs, prototypes and other project work products to ensure fulfillment of the requirements.
Gatekeeper of Requirements. Should be able to raise to Customer PM counterpart or internal stakeholders if : (1) issues reported are not within the signed-off requirements; (2) a technical implementation of a solution will trigger a change in the signed-off requirements and solution;
Scheduling and Project Tracking. Work with development team in completing the work estimates and scheduling the work to be done. Scheduling of project must comply with TransUnion best practice and set of standards.
Production Support. Lead the handover or onboarding plan to Production Support, and/or conduct knowledge hand-over to Level 1 to ensure that the latter can be able to provide Level 1 support effectively. As an SME on the functionality of the solution, provides Level 2 or Level 3 support when the need arises.
Continue to build on technical and business knowledge. Seek out innovations in process improvement, better utilization of resources, product enhancements, improved communications and faster issue resolution.
As appropriate, ensure that post implementation support is provided for projects and/or products that have been developed or enhanced to ensure that they are working effectively and efficiently and that customers ' needs are addressed in a timely manner and SLA's are met 100'.
Perform other related duties as assigned.
What You'll Bring

The duties and responsibilities described above are the essential functions of the job. The qualifications below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required.

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field. Or equivalent work experience. Project Management certification or successful completion of a recognized project management curriculum is required.

Experience: Typically has at least 10 years of total IT work experience.

Must have at least 3 years of work experience as an IT Project Manager for system or application IT-related projects such as application package implementation, system integration, mobile app development or software development. Experience as a Vendor delivering a project to an external customer is a must.

Must have at least 3 to 5 years of work experience as Business Analyst or System Analyst or equivalent position with an emphasis on requirements elicitation and documentation, software development with systems background, or hands-on knowledge of software development lifecycle and development methodology.

Exposure to banking or financial services industry is preferred.

Requires excellent written and verbal communications skills with a background in technical communications.

Excellent inter-personal skills with the ability to bridge business and technical perspectives, and ability to build professional relationships. Demonstrated ability to meet critical time sensitive objectives.

Has demonstrated the ability to deliver multiple projects at the same time, and can manage teams with diverse background and different time zones.

Must satisfactorily meet all competency skills identified for this role.

Lenovo

Title: Senior Research Analyst, Quantitative Research
Job_Description:
Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities.

Find out more about Macquarie at www.macquarie.com/about.

We are currently seeking a Senior Research Analyst to join our Quantitative Research team in Hong Kong.

In this role you will:

1) Independently undertake thought provoking and commercial research. This task will involve:
generating original ideas, possibly building on current academic work e.g. in accounting, finance, economics, econometrics
exploring new techniques in the fields of Machine Learning, Big Data and Artificial intelligence and how this will impact the equity markets
obtaining, cleaning and organising various datasets, mostly comprising data at security level
writing original code to process the data, test robustness and display the results in a compelling graphical form
writing up in-depth reports that present and interpret the result in a style that is rigorous yet commercial.
2) Service both quantitative and fundamental clients - support, advise and answer queries, assist with special ad-hoc projects and initiatives as assigned.

3) Service and engage with the internal sales/trading desk by actively taking part in the marketing of the global research product and trading ideas. This task will involve running screens, backtests and other types of analytics tool in a timely and reliable manner. In addition, it will involve participating in internal meetings and teach-ins and giving internal presentations.

About you

To be successful you will have:
An academic background in Economics, Accounting or Finance and a post graduate degree (e.g. PhD) from a top-tier university
Experience in a similar role either on the buy side or on the sell side would be an advantage
Proven experience and deep understanding of the working of financial markets
A strong team ethic and previous experience working within a fast paced environment, where you need to show initiative and leadership skills, ability to work independently with little supervision and recognise when to seek help.
Excellent analytical skills and an outgoing personality with strong communication and presentation skills
Experience of using programming languages (ideally R)
A CFA qualification or working towards gaining a CFA qualification would be an advantage
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

Title: Data Analyst
Job_Description:
Responsibilities:
Conduct and support data analytics & database marketing projects
Supply relevant campaign design & measurement information to determine the appropriate marketing strategy
Campaign data extraction, manipulation and analysis of customer data
Generate regular reporting and perform ad-hoc analysis/extractions for campaign purposes
Perform quality control processes to ensure results are accurate and match the specification
Support system report development using various reporting tools
Coordinate with internal Technology, Business Integration, and Data Services departments to resolve data issues and articulate analytic requirements.
Requirements:
Degree in statistics, mathematics, marketing or related business degree
At least 3 years of experience in marketing analytics. Knowledge of statistical modelling is strongly preferred
Experience working with large volume data, including mining, segmentation, predictive modelling or decision support services
Background in consumer trends, research, marketing communications, CRM or loyalty
Solid experience in statistical analysis, predictive modeling, optimization and/or similar data driven business solutions.
MS SQL Server Stored Procedure skills are a must. Experience working with database (MSSQL Server, Oracle or MySQL) or Big Data (AWS, Hadoop). SAS (Base or Enterprise Miner) or SPSS or R skills are highly preferable. Proficiency in MS Excel, Access and PowerPoint. Google Analytics, Telerik, Tableau, MS Project skill a bonus.

Title: Asset Management, Junior Portfolio Manager/Quantitative Researcher, Quant Beta Strategies, Associate / Analyst
Job_Description:
J.P. Morgan Asset & Wealth Management, with client assets of $2.4 trillion, is a global leader in investment and wealth management. Its clients include institutions, high-net-worth individuals and retail investors in every major market throughout the world. The division offers investment management across all major asset classes including equities, fixed income, alternatives, multi-asset and money market funds. For individual investors, the business also provides retirement products and services, brokerage and banking services including trusts and estates, loans, mortgages and deposits.

We are looking for a Hong Kong-based Junior Portfolio Manager/Quantitative Researcher to join Quantitative Beta Strategies (QBS) within J.P. Morgan Asset Management. QBS is part of Beta Strategies and is responsible for managing and developing a suite of quantitatively-driven, factor-based portfolios. This includes alternative beta and strategic beta products across all major liquid asset classes.

Job Description

The primary function of this role is supporting the day-to-day management of the team's portfolios in addition to quantitative investment research. This position will have extensive interaction and collaboration with investment professionals in other parts of the firm.

Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
Providing implementation support, including segregated accounts, mutual funds and ETFs
Driving improvement in portfolio management processes, efficiency, risk control, and operational processes
Performing ad hoc analysis on portfolios and investment strategies
Collaboration with technology professionals to improve portfolio management and risk systems
Working with client-facing professionals to deliver periodic client reports, ad-hoc client queries, and proposals
Researching, developing, and testing investment strategies from both a theoretical and practical standpoint
Experience managing, researching, and developing quantitative strategies (e.g. factor-based/risk premia investing) is an advantage
Strong academic background (advanced degree(s) in a quantitative discipline advantageous)
Ability to perform well under pressure and deliver within tight deadlines
Strong attention to detail and ability to collaborate with others
Ambitious self-starter able to think independently
Proficiency in programing languages (MATLAB, VBA, SQL, Python advantageous)
Highly developed quantitative and analytical skills and ability to tackle quantitative research projects both independently and collaboratively
Strong investment interest and desire to learn (e.g. willingness to work towards CFA charter)
The ability to read, write and speak Chinese (Mandarin) is highly desired

Title: TRAINEE: Quantitative Research
Job_Description:
Environment
SG CIB is the Corporate and Investment Banking arm of the Societe Generale Group. Present in over 50 countries across Europe, the Americas and Asia.SG CIB provides corporate, financial institutions, investors and public sector clients with value-added integrated financial solutions.

The Research Trainee will be based in Hong Kong. The successful candidate will be given a firsthand experience of mainly quantitative strategy research within the field of investment banking. He will help the quantitative team in its research work and will have a dedicated research topic on the forecast of the volatility of financial indices. This position offers the opportunity to work with one of the best ranked teams within quantitative research in investment banking. The team is based in multiple geographies and works closely with the front-office business lines.

Mission

Main Responsibilities

Analyse different models to forecast the volatility of financial indices

Classical econometric models like GARCH and asymmetric GARCH models
Use of intraday data
Use of exogenous data and analysis of different machine learning regression algorithms to forecast the volatility
Help the quantitative research team in its research work
Manage the production of model screeners and analytics
Assist the team in handling client requests and bespoke research

Profile
Hold a relevant Bachelors or Masters degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Finance or similar
Strong programming skills (R, Python)
Knowledge in statistics, machine learning and big data
Open and inquisitive mind, strong interest in research
Strong team work and communication skills
Able to build good working relationships with colleagues
Able to deal with a quickly changing environment in a calm and efficient manner
A flexible approach to work
Able to work under pressure, prioritize different tasks and requirements
Able to take responsibility and work independently
Fluent English is mandatory

This is a fixed term 12 month Trainee contract with Societe Generale. You will form part of the team on a full time basis. In order to apply for the Trainee position please ensure you have completed your qualification and will be available to work full time for the duration of the Trainee contract.

Title: Global Data - Market Data Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Requisition Number:59836

Bloomberg, the global business and financial information and news leader, gives influential decision makers a critical edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas. The company's strength - delivering data, news and analytics through innovative technology, quickly and accurately - is at the core of the Bloomberg Professional service, which provides real time financial information to more than 315,000 subscribers globally.

What's Global Data all about?

Global Data makes Bloomberg the most sought-after data source in the world. We collect, analyze, and present data that informs clients' decisions - and moves markets. We collaborate with Sales, News, and Research and Development, while staying in tune with our client needs, contributing to the development of the Data Management products and fueling Bloomberg news stories with the data that we receive. We also apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies and implement technological solutions to enhance our systems and processes.

We'll trust you to:
Acquire, update, maintain and process financial data using various internal systems and proprietary company software
Develop expertise in fast-moving market sector information
Provide a platinum level of service to Bloomberg customers through interaction with market players/clients as well as Sales, News and other business units
Liaise with technology teams to enhance relevant product databases and processes
Intake and distill raw data to convey actionable information that enables our clients to make better-informed decisions
Come up with innovative ways to enhance our systems and to make our data-related processes more efficient
Participate in time-sensitive projects, and collaborate with your global colleagues to deliver new initiatives
What's in it for you?
Comprehensive 4-week training program giving you a thorough overview of financial concepts, various data sets, and of course our state-of-the-art Bloomberg terminal
Gain in-depth, hands-on experience of one particular market sector (For example: Equities, Fixed Income, Derivatives etc.)
Exposure to and interaction with key market players in the financial industry
Real potential for exciting and varied career-progression
What we look for?
Bachelor's degree (or expected to graduate in 2018) in Account, Finance, Business, Economics or any related discipline, with up to 2 years of work experience
Strong passion and drive to actively challenge the status quo and seek improvements for the product
Solid application of financial knowledge in prior coursework or work experience
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Strong project management and organizational skill
Ability to adapt to a fluid environment
Fluency in both written and spoken English and Chinese (Cantonese or Mandarin)
Wed love to see:
Master's degree in Business Administration, Financial Engineering, CFA, FRM or equivalent
Experience in applying market knowledge and converting financial data into meaningful analysis for evaluating performance of economy/stocks/financial products
Knowledge or experience in computer programming or statistical analysis such as VBA, R, Python or SQL
Experience in process engineering and relevant technology such as Visio
Does this sound like you?

Apply today! If we think you're a match, we'll get in touch with you soon about next steps.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: ConsumerSr. Manager Advanced Analytics North East Asia Cluster (Japan)
Job_Description:
The Sr. Manager, Market Research and Integrated Analytics is responsible for generating, integrating and translating insights and analytics into growth opportunities and tactics that shape decisions and drive organizational action for brands within Johnson & Johnson North East Asia (NEA). This person based in Tokyo will serve as an internal consultant to partner closely with brand or franchise leadership and cross functional partners. This position plays a leading role in advising and counseling management in the development and evaluation of new and existing business strategies and tactics and as a result, shares accountability for business results.

Tasks/Duties/Responsibilities include:

Lead cross functional projects from planning and design to turning insights into strategy with business partners. Then partnering in taking strategy to tactical design. Focus on key business questions and frame business problems into primary research and or analytics plans in marketing, sales and payer spaces. Determine optimal research/ analytic approaches, identify appropriate supplier partners, foster strong partnerships in the context of resources, timing and overall project goals. Provide strategic input to help shape strategic and business plans, sales & brand strategies and new product launch plans/ life cycle management for brands. Influence business partners at all levels to incorporate insights into decision making.
Drive innovation through objective research and analysis and the integration of insights enabling organizational decision making and action. Champion the development and implementation of analytics approaches and methods which are innovative and examples of best practices. The ability to demonstrate leadership courage to set boundaries and ensure time is spent on the most critical/ high value projects is critical.
Serve as a leader in integrating primary research and analytics insights with cross functional findings and insights developed by peers across the Commercial Insights & Strategy team (forecasting, business intelligence, and advanced analytics/ commercial mix modeling/ ROI)) and translating into strategies and brand actions that drive tangible growth in revenue and or profit. He/she will routinely provide integrated insights that drive sales and marketing strategies for respective brand or franchise. Cultivate meaningful internal and external partnerships, adding value and insights for the organization; being insight driven to uncover important unmet needs.
Ensure seamless integration of analytics across key data sources to evaluate business performance and impact of marketing and sales tactics. Title: 2018 Financial Products Analytics & Sales - (English/ Korean Speaker)
Job_Description:
Job Requisition Number:61886

Bloomberg, the global business and financial information and news leader, gives influential decision makers a critical edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas. The company's strength - delivering data, news and analytics through innovative technology, quickly and accurately - is at the core of the Bloomberg Professional service, which provides real time financial information to more than 315,000 subscribers globally.

What's the role?

Are you passionate about the financial markets and excited by the prospect of creating customized solutions for the world's leading financial professionals? If so, join our comprehensive training program for Analytics Representatives in our Sales and Analytics group, a key part of our Financial Products business.

Analytics Representatives are integral to the Bloomberg Help Desk, taking questions from clients who use our state-of-the-art Bloomberg Terminal, also known as the Bloomberg Professional Service. Whether you are helping construct a relative comparison sheet for a research analyst, advising a portfolio manager on our risk management tools, or providing liquidity analysis solutions to a trader, you will continuously create innovative solutions for our clients.

What's Financial Products all about?

The Financial Products team provides analysis and data to Bloomberg clients. We deliver the company's core product, the legendary Bloomberg Professional Service, reaching millions of business professionals. Sales and Analytics work together as partners to provide value-added business solutions to our customers through the Bloomberg Professional Service.
Our team of Analytics Representatives delivers exceptional service through real-time chats, phone calls and face-to-face trainings to our customers on a daily basis. The team showcases basic and advanced Bloomberg solutions to meet our clients' specific workflow needs.
Our Terminal Sales team is responsible for demonstrating the advantages of our suite of solutions to both potential and existing clients. With a consultative approach, they identify our clients' needs and present Bloomberg solutions to help them make the best investment or trading decisions.
What to expect

When you join Analytics Team, you'll start off in a comprehensive training program designed to develop your cross asset and product knowledge so that you're prepared to interact with our clients on the Bloomberg Help Desk. Through daily interactions with key players in the financial industry, you will further enhance your skills in managing client relationships and problem solving.

Working as an Analytics Representative opens doors to other career opportunities within Bloomberg. The typical career path will lead to a Terminal Sales role. However, within Analytics, opportunities do exist in management and Advanced Specialist position. Advanced Specialists provide the highest level of product support, mentor colleagues and deliver training, working closely with Research & Development.

What we look for

We look for candidates who have earned a Bachelor's degree prior to joining us (expected to graduate in 2018) or who have relevant work experience.

We also require:
Ability to work well under pressure and to multi-task effectively
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Korean
Good team player
Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills
Immense interest in the financial markets
Proficient in Microsoft Excel
Travel could be required once in Sales
In addition, these skills and experiences can help distinguish you from other candidates for this role:
Coursework in finance, economics and/or business, although all majors are welcome
Experience using the Bloomberg Terminal
Desire and flexibility to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment
Experience in and enthusiasm for customer service
Proven ability to sell, with interest in pursuing a career in sales
Does this sound like you?

Apply today! If we think you're a match, we'll get in touch with you soon about next steps.

At Aurexia, we believe that we all develop faster when working together as an integrated team including clients for this reason collaboration and knowledge sharing are key cornerstones of our principles. Hands-on use of big data in large and complex projects using Hadoop, Spark would be a plus
Work Experience and Education Guidelines:
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering, Economics, or similar
Experience in a role focused on statistical modelling, econometrics, marketing attribution, data science or similar
Passionate about data, models and visualizations
Excellent problem-solving skills, self-motivated with the capacity to work under pressure and tight deadlines
Previous experience with SAS a big plus

Title: Hedge Fund Market Data Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Requisition Number:64083

Bloomberg runs on data, and our Global Data department is responsible for acquiring it and supplying it to our clients. Our Market Data Analysts collect, analyse, process and publish the data which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal- the data which ultimately moves the financial universe. They apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and they implement technology solutions to improve our systems, products and processes- and all this while providing platinum customer support to our customers.

Wherever a hedge fund is in its life cycle, Bloomberg has the data, solutions and industry network to help our clients take it to the next level. We provide a suite of hedge fund solutions which give our clients a framework to make smarter, faster and more informed financial decisions.

The Role

Our team in Hong Kong is looking for a driven individual with sound knowledge of the hedge fund industry and well-honed client-facing skills, to develop and expand the scope of our Hedge Fund and Investment Mandates Data products.

Well trust you to:
Acquire, maintain and improve the comprehensiveness of our hedge fund-related data content
Build and maintain relationships with a range of market players within the hedge fund industry

Collaborate closely with Sales teams to provide excellent service to the Bloomberg Investor Community
Provide support to internal and external clients and stakeholders on our Hedge Fund product functionality and data content
Manage multiple industry-specific projects simultaneously and ensure that deliverables are met
Facilitate lines of communication between internal and external stakeholders to ensure data consistency and accuracy
Work with a high degree of autonomy- setting your own goals and milestones, and driving them to conclusion
Identify innovative work-flow efficiencies and implement enhancements to our systems, processes and data
Whats in it for you?
Gain in-depth hands-on experience of the hedge funds industry
Learn continuously from industry experts and work closely with key decision makers every single day
Make a true business impact on our products and clients our data moves markets!
Real opportunity for exciting and varied career progression
Youll need to have:
At least 4 years relevant work experience in client service, sales support or marketing within the Hedge Fund, Private Equity or Asset Management industry- or prior experience in a Hedge Fund Research role
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the interact confidently with stakeholders of all levels
Proven track record of building and maintaining client relationships
Project management experience with the ability to lead and influence multiple stakeholders while working to tight deadlines
Well-practiced research and analytical skills with meticulous attention to detail
Ability to think critically with proven examples of having improved processes, systems or procedures
Demonstrated interest in and knowledge of the hedge fund industry
Wed love to see:
Experience or knowledge in data management tools and workflows in a related role or function
Business fluency in English plus Mandarin and/or Cantonese
If this sounds like you:

Apply! If we think you're a good match we'll get in touch to let you know the next steps.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist
Job_Description:
Why LYNK?
LYNK is a VC-backed, product-driven startup working with leading institutional clients, top level experts and thought leaders globally
We operate in a high-octane environment where our people think about the big picture and always strive to "make it happen"
Our team, spread across four countries today (and growing!), is multinational, multilingual and multicultural. Our clients have likened us to a mini United Nations.

What You'll Do:
Identify potential uses of mathematical modelling to improve the performance of the business

Develop mathematical models such as financial prediction models and automation tools in Python and R (e.g. automatic slide-deck generation, machine learning infrastructure) to assist with budget considerations based on an understanding of the underlying structure of the business and the market
Develop classification and regression models (e.g. customer lifetime value prediction, user acquisition cost) to build an understanding of the customer to drive optimal customer interactions.

Minimum 4 years of relevant work experience

An all-around data scientist: strong statistics background, experience in algorithm programming, experimentation, data visualization, machine learning, optimization and big data

(Deep) Neural Networks, Natural language processing Hidden Markov Models, Conditional Random Fields, Game Theory, Mechanism Design, Latent Dirichlet Allocation.

Solid experience with the Hadoop ecosystem
Solid experience in implementing multi-core/distributed software
Experienced in solving real problems using machine learning techniques and with statistical rigor
Excellent communication skills; the ability to convey complex analysis results clearly and with conviction to all stakeholder levels

You will report to the Head of Hong Kong office and will work closely with the Product and Operations Team in Paris. As a data analyst, you will follow an action plan, issuing various deliverables during the mission. You will guarantee the integrity of webanalytics data as well as its interpretation during delivery sessions with the client. You will be responsible for the content, the format and the overall quality of the outputs delivered to the client and for monitoring their operational and technical implementation.

Based on your good understanding of our missions and our clients' needs, you will collaborate with all our teams to develop fifty-five's offer, both in terms of marketing and in terms of technical and operational delivery.

Job description

Deliver missions related to the monitoring of the client's digital activity based on key performance indicators (reporting), to onsite conversion optimisation through data analysis and webtesting, and to online media buy optimisation
Analyse data and structure relevant information for the client's benefit, in line with business indicators specific to their industry (eg. mobile operators, retail, travel, etc.)
Develop a sharp operational expertise on both conversion and online media-buy topics
Meet clients' needs and pay attention to the quality of all deliverables
Education and Experience

Master's degree (business, engineering) or equivalent diploma
Native Japanese speaker
Fluent English written and spoken
0-2 years (analyst) / 3-5 years (senior analyst) experience in project management or digital marketing, consulting firms (strategy, organization, change management, IS, etc.), business Intelligence software publishers (SAP, etc.), or media-buy agencies, digital or traditional
Knowledge of the main online acquisition channels: search engines (SEO, SEM and bid-management tools), display, affiliate marketing, emailing, social media, AdExchange, web and mobile applications, etc.
Industry webanalytics tools
Skills and Interests

Excellent communication, both oral and written
Strong analytical skills
Good social spirit
Laid back but professional
Curious and willing to learn (a lot!)
Strong interest in new technologies and the digital industry
Conditions

Starting asap
You need to have a working permit.
Please submit your resume to
recruitment-hk@fifty-five.com
Copied

Title: HR Analytics Specialist
Job_Description:
Environment

SG CIB is the Corporate and Investment Banking arm of the Societe Generale Group. Present in over 50 countries across Europe, the Americas and Asia. SG CIB provides corporate, financial institutions, investors and public sector clients with value-added integrated financial solutions.

Mission

The HR Analytics specialist is responsible for providing new and impactful dashboards and for developing HR analytics culture across Asia. He oversees SSC-HR reporting team in Bangalore and monitors the timely delivery of HR reports.

The HR Analytics specialist is in charge of refining the data governance framework to enhance the delivery of HR analytics. He / she also takes part in technical enhancements and digitalisation initiatives.

The HR Analytics specialist works closely with both Asia and France HR teams, with the regional Business Partners / COOs. He / she reports to the Head of HR Analytics for Asia.


Main Responsibilities

Provide new and impactful dashboards and develop an HR analytics culture
Implement new dashboards focusing on business relevant areas
Provide executive summaries with actionable insights for key dashboards
Work closely with HR Asia teams and with regional Business Partners / COOs to co-design and co-construct new dashboards
Conduct change management actions
Collect market intelligence
Be aware of HR data and other relevant analytics initiatives run internally
Connect regularly with Paris on the HRIS masterplan

Oversight management of HR Shared Services reporting team in Bangalore (2-3 staff)
Manage performance of SSC-HR reporting team
Ensure the quarterly delivery of the quarterly HR Key Indicators report
Reinforce framework around automated reports, ensure exhaustiveness and homogeneity of data produced
Define the governance between onsite and offshore teams

Refine the data governance framework to enhance the delivery of HR analytics
Contribute to the rollout of the global HR data governance and data quality program in Asia
Conduct annual user recertification and educate users on data protection
Enhance user guides to fit the needs of users in Asia
Continue data glossary policies and data quality monitoring
Improve access rights management of shared folders
Propose, perform and follow-up technical enhancements

Lead or participate in digitalisation and innovation projects in Asia

Profile
Strong organisational and analytical skills
Client focused with strong communication skills
Ability to supervise staff and to deliver results through Shared Services teams
Project management skills
Solution driven and ability to work autonomously
Process oriented, ability to challenge and simplify processes
Attention to detail and strong sense of operational control
Thinks outside the box to bring new ideas
Proficient in MS Office and BI tools
Fluent in English
Prior work experience in Human Resources

Title: Marketing Analytics, Data Scientist - Sr. Manager
Job_Description:
Marketing Analytics Data Scientist

Job level - Group/Sr. Manager

Job Location - Open to any US Location / remote

*This Role requires specific Marketing Analytics experience.

About the role:

The Group Manager, Marketing Analytics and Insights role oversees and manages the global marketing data and analytics function and is responsible for setting and deploying the marketing data and analytics strategy, managing marketing measurement, reporting and analytics processes, maintaining and managing existing data sources, and generating insights to ensure optimal efficiency, effectiveness and ROI of all marketing campaigns and activities. The role is also engaged in marketing planning, marketing analytics best practice creation, staying abreast of thought leadership in the field and knowledge sharing among the global marketing community.

Day-to-day, you will:

Marketing Data and Analytics Strategy
Oversee and manage the global marketing data and analytics function with the aim of running a best-in-class function that facilitates data and insights based decision making
Define and deploy the global marketing data and analytics strategy to help move the organization from siloed to integrated data collection and reporting with deeper analysis and actionable insights generating capabilities.
Stay abreast of and ensure adherence to industry thought leadership and best practices in marketing analytics and facilitate knowledge sharing and training among the global marketing community
Work with Digital Marketing Platforms lead to ensure we have the right marketing technology stack
Work with Avanade legal team to ensure we are compliant with internal and external policies, GDPR in particular
Measurement, Reporting and Insights Generation
Manage the end-to-end marketing measurement and reporting framework enabling results reporting, marketing business reviews and analytics and insights generation
Manage the monthly and quarterly marketing reporting process and leadership reviews and accountable for the compilation, preparation and translation of complicated data into simple high level information for leadership to communicate marketing results
Work closely with Field, Area and Corporate marketing teams to collect and analyze data and identify key insights to enable data driven decision making
Establish a new and improved reporting platform on Power BI (working with ITS) and transfer all existing Marketing scorecards to new platform Analyze existing data from Marketing data sources and provide insights to the business stakeholders to make informed business decisions
Maintain and manage data sources, develop data strategy and governance and oversee the Marketing Data and Analytics Specialist
Educate and train our "customers" in data interpretation and analysis making them increasingly self-serviced
Marketing Planning:
Work closely with Digital & Marketing Effectiveness lead to manage and execute the global marketing annual planning process and ensure appropriate integration and operational alignment with the overall global Avanade planning cadence
Manage annual target setting process (aligning plans with measurement and reporting framework)
Train and support Field, Area and Corporate marketing functions in development of annual marketing plans and target setting, ensuring plans align with business and marketing goals
Facilitate intergroup communication within marketing teams and with other groups (e.g., Sales, IT) for alignment of plans ensuring adherence to objectives and standards
Support in development of annual Global Marketing Business Plan
About Avanade

At Avanade, our vision is to be the leading digital innovator, realizing results for our clients and their customers through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem.

Through thousands of projects, we've transformed businesses for the digital world. We've helped them create compelling experiences for their customers and employees. We've reduced costs, increased productivity, enabled collaboration and enhanced agility - and ultimately improved performance.

Avanade, which is majority owned by Accenture, was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation and has 29,000 professionals in more than 20 countries. Additional information can be found at www.avanade.com

Qualifications

Likely years' experience
6+ years of experience in marketing analytics/marketing data science, reporting and data management in a technology industry B2B environment.
Advanced analytical skills and ability to conduct analysis and create reports, dashboards in Excel, Google Analytics and Power BI (Marketo and MS Dynamics CRM a plus)
Outstanding organizational skills and attention to detail with ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage time effectively
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
Flexibility and ability to thrive in a global, virtual and fast-paced environment and must be able to work with minimal supervision and direction and willing to work remotely
Strong ability to interact with all levels of management in a professional manner
Excellent and advanced Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills as well as familiarity with Microsoft collaboration tools such as Microsoft Teams, Visual Studio etc.
Your education likely

Bachelor's degree minimum, preferred MS or MBA

About Avanade

Is An Equal Opportunity Employer. Avanade promotes equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, status as a protected disabled or Vietnam Era Veteran, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Requisition ID - 50657

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital and cloud-enabling services, business solutions and design-led experiences, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation and has 30,000 professionals in 24 countries. Visit us at www.avanade.com.

Title: Associate, Rating Analytical (Commodities Sector)
Job_Description:
The Role: Associate, Rating Analytical (Commodities Sector)

The Location: Hong Kong

The Team / The Business: You will be part of a global and multicultural team.

The Impact: You will analyze original, non-routine and complex situations in a timely, orderly and insightful manner. Developing and maintaining a deep understanding of industry trends and issues.

The Career Opportunity: This is a great opportunity for experienced professionals within the financial industry to deepen its analytical skills and industry insights. You will act in an analytical position covering a portfolio of leading corporate issuers in the commodity sectors in the Great China region. As a primary analyst for credits in the corporate sectors, you will not only perform analytical work and write reports, but also demonstrate your analytical insight to internal and external audiences in an international working environment.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for managing a portfolio of credits
Attend meetings and interact with senior management of corporations to obtain information upon which to base credit rating decisions
Actively participate and be engaged in rating committees. Present recommendations and your rationale to the rating committee
Actively participate in regional and global analytical work groups to maintain and enhance our analytical industry expertise
Prepare a variety of materials suitable for publication (rating reports, press releases) to disseminate and explain our ratings on a timely basis
Prepare commentaries/ papers on areas of expertise for publication
Share knowledge/ participate in initiatives to improve group operations (through sharing analytical expertise, coaching to more junior staff, project work)
Cooperate with non-analytical staff to ensure that the process dimension of the analytical process is properly executed
Demonstrate service excellence and professionalism towards external and internal clients
What were looking for:
Bachelor degree holder of Finance, Business Administration, or a related subject
Holder of CFA Designation is preferable
5 years of relevant work experience as a credit analyst, equity research or auditing, consulting experience in the commodity related sectors.
Strong network and understanding of the Commodities (chemicals, metals & mining) market in the Greater China region
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English and Mandarin
Solid analytical capability, team player and has good time management skills
Able to multi-task and meet projects with a tight time frame
Ability to work under tight deadlines in a fast-changing, global and regulated environment
Willingness to travel, sometimes at short notice
About S&P Global Ratings

S&P Global Ratings is the worlds leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.

S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or other legally protected categories, subject to applicable law.

Title: Enterprise Product - Portfolio Analytics and Index Sales
Job_Description:
Job Requisition Number:64194

Our Portfolio & Index Sales teams put the industrys most powerful Portfolio and Risk Analytics Solution (PORT) as well as Bloomberg Barclays Indices and proprietary indices at the fingertips of global investment professionals. Our solutions help our clients make quicker and more informed decision by empowering them with the tools to define appropriate investment universes with benchmarks, successfully implement optimal investment portfolio strategies, easily and accurately measure portfolio risk and return, and streamline their overall investment management workflow.

What's the role?

You're someone that understands the nuts and bolts of portfolio management, perhaps acquired at a buy-side firm or whilst working for another vendor. With a consultative approach, youll identify our clients' needs and demonstrate how PORT and our indices will help them make the best investment and/or trading decisions.

Coupled with this technical knowledge will be an astute commercial mindset, meeting clients face-to-face on a regular basis and working to exceed sales metrics. Youll also be an excellent communicator, well adept at giving product demonstrations and presentations to current clients and prospects.

We'll trust you to:
Acquire new clients and expand the footprint of Bloomberg's Portfolio and Risk Analytics & Bloomberg Barclays Indices
Manage client engagement and relationships particularly in the buy-side sector
Collaborate with internal financial products groups to deliver the Bloomberg value proposition to such clients
Achieve sales targets and agreed level of client engagement activities
Communicate and effectively manage internal senior stakeholders and external portfolio manager clients
Provide detailed product feedback from clients to internal business managers in an effort to continually improve our products
Take a lead role in conducting internal and client training sessions
Travel extensively to meet with clients and prospects, primarily based in Greater China markets
You'll need to have:
Fluency in English. Mandarin, Cantonese, and/or Korean would be highly advantageous
Demonstrable ability to identify new prospects and build and maintain solid client relationships
Minimum 3 years experience working in or selling to the buy-side i.e. pension funds, investment advisors or mutual funds, or alternatively, experience in financial engineering/structuring
Equity and/or Fixed Income market experience and knowledge
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Aptitude to excel in a dynamic, rapidly growing environment
A self-starter and proactive collaborator with strong multi-tasking skills
If this sounds like you:

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know the next steps but in the meantime feel free to browse this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/portfolio-risk-analytics/

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Associate Data Scientist, SAS Global Pre-Sales Academy
Job_Description:
Company Overview

SAS technology allow its customers to achieve results in a wide range of diverse industries. From ensuring your bank account is not compromised to analyzing the data behind which drugs go to market faster, or helping with natural disasters, SAS is changing the way big data is used every day! #Data4Good

The SAS Global Presales Academy is a paid 18 week 7/16/18 - 11/16/18 concentrated technical program that provides training in SAS' core technology (advanced analytics, data management and visualization), consultative skills and methodology, product positioning, business practices and equips trainees with the necessary skills to succeed. As an Associate Data Scientist, you will provide technical assistance for software presale and/or post-sale activities utilizing knowledge of industry segment processes and challenges.

Primary Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Work with the sales team on technical activities to maximize revenue opportunities and ensure the highest levels of customer satisfaction.
Provide consultative services, including architecture recommendations to support proposed solution and possess technical aptitude to solve complex big data business problems based on SAS core competencies in advanced analytics, data management, and visualization.
Translate business requirements into SAS technical solutions and link to business value.
Identifies appropriate architecture, application, tools, and solutions for targeted accounts.
Prepares technical demonstrations, proof of concepts, and presentations based on client needs.
Conduct discovery meetings to collect, analyze, clarify and document business requirements during the sales cycle to support the implementation team and to produce a detailed solution proposal.
Develops familiarity with company sales initiatives, product positioning, pricing, proposals, and models.
Essential
Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Management Information Systems, Engineering, Business, or other related quantitative field.
Strong analytical, technical and problem solving skills.
Academic projects or work experience in information technology, engineering, and/or business analysis.
Significant project and/or internship experience demonstrating individual and team work abilities.
Candidates must be willing to work in Cary, NC, USA for the duration of the Academy program.
Ability to travel up to 30-40% or as business needs dictate.
Strong written & verbal English language communication skills & Cantonese fluency.
Strong academic performance [Minimum GPA of 3.0]
Additional
Excellent written and oral communication, analytical, problem solving and interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate and present to users from various technical backgrounds.
Demonstrate good judgement in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.
Ability to understand customer pain points and recommend SAS products/solutions that address those areas.
Self-motivated and able to work under pressure.
Preferences
Experience programming with languages such as R, Python, SAS, Lua or similar.
1 year of programming in SAS or languages related to assigned area.
Knowledge of software development life cycles.
Public speaking experience such as presenting papers or classroom teaching.
Understanding of Unix/ Linux or data warehouse architectures.
Additional Information

To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in Hong Kong, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.

SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

The level of this position will be determined based on the applicant's education, skills and experience.

Resumes may be considered in the order they are received.

SAS employees performing certain job functions may require access to technology or software subject to export or import regulations. To comply with these regulations, SAS may obtain nationality or citizenship information from applicants for employment. SAS collects this information solely for trade law compliance purposes and does not use it to discriminate unfairly in the hiring process.

About SAS:

SAS believes in the whole employee experience. Meaningful work. Empowerment to make a difference that changes people's lives. Dynamic work environments that foster innovation. And an award-winning culture that makes it all possible. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. Whether you're a university recruit, or an experienced professional ready for the next big challenge, SAS brings perks, passion, and the potential to grow. No limits.

Want to stay up to date on SAS culture, products and jobs? Follow us on LinkedIn

Title: Associate - Corporate Analytics
Job_Description:
Why Ipreo:

Imagine a job where you...
Work directly with senior managers on a regular basis
Have a meaningful impact on the mission-critical products and services that clients rely on every single day
Collaborate with colleagues across business lines and regions
At Ipreo, this is true for EVERY MEMBER of our global organization! Our technology solutions and analytical insights are relied upon by every major investment bank and thousands of corporations around the world.

Ipreo is seeking experienced candidates with investor knowledge that can make an immediate impact providing clients with investor insights. Additionally, this role provides the opportunity to manage & train analysts on the team. The Corporate Analytics group works closely with clients in the investor relations function at publicly-traded companies. The role is client facing, and you will develop direct client relationships as well as assist clients with topics that have a visible impact on high-level decision making; often used in presentations to the c-suite and board of directors of our clients' companies.

While analytical in nature, our goal is to provide insight and intelligence to assist clients, rather than just provide data. Analysts are exposed to diverse subject matter ranging from fundamental analysis, capital markets activity, and analyzing shareholder behavior. Given the focus of our clients and their needs, the team operates in a fast-paced environment where quality and accuracy is just as important as a timely response.

The ability to multitask is critical, as well as working well as a team to accomplish responsibilities. In addition to supporting clients, the Corporate Analytics group serves as a subject matter expert and analytical resource to internal groups on topics such as corporate capital allocation policy, shareholder behavior around transactions such as M&A and spinoffs.

Given the diversity of subject matter and direct client interactions, the Corporate Analytics role is a unique opportunity to gain broad exposure to topics driving financial markets, while at the same time gaining a specialty in knowledge of the institutional investment community and shareholder behavior.

What you'll work on:
Collaborate with team members and maintaining existing client relationships
Analyzing the flow of institutional capital and providing actionable intelligence on investor behavior
Servicing clients with timely market, fundamental and shareholder information
Producing scheduled deliverables and ad hoc reports in a timely and accurate fashion
Utilizing datasets and information from both internal and external applications
What we look for:
BA or BS Degree is required
2-5 years of experience
Experience with Capital Markets and/or Institutional Investors
Previous financial and analytical experience
Superior analytical reasoning, oral and written communication skills
Ability to work both independently (as a self-starter) and within a dynamic team
Ability to collaborate with teammates located in global Ipreo offices, across time zones
Ability to absorb large amounts of information in a high energy, fast-paced environment
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Motivation to learn new software applications and datasets
Detail oriented; able to multi-task; strong organizational skills
Resourceful and able to contribute creative solutions to client questions and internal functions
Comfortable working with clients of all different levels

Title: Quantitative Researcher - Intern
Job_Description:
Quantitative Researcher - Intern
Experience
Interns and Entry Level
Location
New York | London | Hong Kong | Paris
Area
Systematic Investing
Business
Cubist
