Title: Director - Quantitative Research Development
Job_Description:
Environment
SG CIB is the Corporate and Investment Banking arm of the Societe Generale Group. Present in over 50 countries across Europe, the Americas and Asia. SG CIB provides corporate, financial institutions, investors and public sector clients with value-added integrated financial solutions.

Mission
Major Accountabilities


The Quantitative Research Development team addresses all issues of a quantitative nature within the Capital Markets division. Its main areas of focus are:
Designing models and algorithms for the pricing of exotic trades
Coding and testing of such algorithms for subsequent implementation (by separate team) in pricing library
Studying product risks and advising on hedging strategies and pricing methodologies
Studying historical data and advising on levels of exotic parameters (vols of vols, correlations etc)
Expertise on transversal subjects such as CVA, IM
SG's Quant team is at the forefront of technical innovation in derivatives modelling. Two of its members are well known figures in the industry: they are recipients of the Quant of the Year award and authors of reference books.

Profile
Summary of Responsibilities


The successful applicant is expected to bring high-level technical expertise to SG's trading desks in Hong Kong on all topics relevant to Quant department mandate. They are expected to:
Have modelling AND numerical experience commensurate to their seniority
Have excellent command of models for equities, rates, credit
Be able to code up from scratch any model for any asset class
Be able to take on issues of general relevance to QRD
Be able to generate her / his own research agenda
This is not a library / pricing quant position.

The successful applicant will be highly autonomous. Weekly video conferencing with the team in Paris ensures the free flow of ideas and the sharing of code.

Interact on a daily basis with traders and less frequently with structurers and Risk control functions.

Behavioural Skills


Team Spirit

The employee encourages collective success
Innovation

The employee will create conditions that encourage innovation
Responsibility

The employee acts with integrity and in an ethical manner
Commitment

The employee is committed to the role and inspires others
Client Orientation

The employee actively improves his / her relationship with clients

Title: Data Analyst / Senior Data Analyst
Job_Description:
Within the small but fired-up team based in Hong Kong, you will actively take part in delivering fifty-five's missions to multiple clients across the region. Those missions relate to onsite conversion optimisation and/or digital media-mix optimisation. During these missions, you will contribute to promoting a new user-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of Hong Kong office and will work closely with the Product and Operations Team in Paris. As a data analyst, you will follow an action plan, issuing various deliverables during the mission. You will guarantee the integrity of webanalytics data as well as its interpretation during delivery sessions with the client. You will be responsible for the content, the format and the overall quality of the outputs delivered to the client and for monitoring their operational and technical implementation.

Based on your good understanding of our missions and our clients' needs, you will collaborate with all our teams to develop fifty-five's offer, both in terms of marketing and in terms of technical and operational delivery.

Job description

Deliver missions related to the monitoring of the client's digital activity based on key performance indicators (reporting), to onsite conversion optimisation through data analysis and webtesting, and to online media buy optimisation
Analyse data and structure relevant information for the client's benefit, in line with business indicators specific to their industry (eg. mobile operators, retail, travel, etc.)
Develop a sharp operational expertise on both conversion and online media-buy topics
Meet clients' needs and pay attention to the quality of all deliverables
Education and Experience

Master's degree (business, engineering) or equivalent diploma
Fluent English & Cantonese Speaker (Mandarin is a plus)
0-2 years (analyst) / 3-5 years (senior analyst) experience in project management or digital marketing, consulting firms (strategy, organization, change management, IS, etc.), business Intelligence software publishers (SAP, etc.), or media-buy agencies, digital or traditional
Knowledge of the main online acquisition channels: search engines (SEO, SEM and bid-management tools), display, affiliate marketing, emailing, social media, AdExchange, web and mobile applications, etc.
Industry webanalytics tools
Skills and Interests

Excellent communication, both oral and written
Strong analytical skills
Good social spirit
Laid back but professional
Curious and willing to learn (a lot!)
Strong interest in new technologies and the digital industry
Conditions

Starting asap
You need to have a working permit.
Please submit your resume to
recruitment-hk@fifty-five.com
Copied

Title: ConsumerSr. Analyst Advanced Analytics North East Asia (Korea)
Job_Description:
Description

This role reports to the Sr. Manager, GSIA North East Asia (NEA) cluster as part of the APAC insights and analytics team. This role supports the Sr. Manager in the management and delivery of insights and analytics projects for NEA Cluster with a primary focus on Korea.

This position will support the Sr. Manager with data-driven decisions in the consumer, shopper and professional domains using insights and analytics tools. Primary accountabilities would include helping to manage project timelines, data collection/quality controls, with internal and external teams. The analyst will also help run the business performance analysis through data analysis, establishing a strong understanding of shoppers and channels data.


Major Responsibilities Include
Project management for implementation of analytics projects across NEA. This includes being point of the contact within the local team to enable smooth communication and clarification of all data directly-responsible individuals to ensure right data is used in all analytics modeling projects.
Support the day-to-day analytics activity for NEA (planning and executing work). This position will be required to partner with the regional analytics on key initiatives in Media Spend Optimization (through Market Mix Models and Business Drivers Analysis), Price and Promotion Analytics by providing data and insights inputs and ensuring engagement with key stakeholders in the market.
Help the NEA organization to set KPIs through the use of quantitative analytics. Help optimization and track the performance of the business and initiatives by providing descriptive, diagnostic and predictive insights beyond the data
Continuous support and education of NEA organization in J&J data and analytics tools like Business Panorama and other business dashboards.
Enable market performance tracking in partnership with the country and regional teams; deploying standardized, automated consistent and globally aligned management reports, dashboards, key performance indicators, and data for self-serve.
Support Sr Manager on any ad-hoc projects that require coordination and alignment of marketing analytics practice.
Qualifications
Qualifications
Bachelors Degree required, Masters degree in Business Administration, Management or Finance preferred.
Minimum 3 years of experience with a commercial or strategy background is preferred.
Strong leadership, communication and interpersonal skills with ability to learn quickly and leverage is required. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (oral and written)
Knowledge in multivariate statistical analysis including regression, regression tree, logistic regression, cluster analysis, behavioral market structure etc. is preferred.
Knowledge of data structure, information systems/tools, and related software and data management, enterprise content management, and record-keeping policies and practices are required.
Primary Location
Japan-Tokyo-To-Chiyoda
Other Locations
Asia Pacific-Taiwan, Asia Pacific-South Korea, Asia Pacific-China-Hong Kong S.A.R.
Organization
Johnson & Johnson K.K. (8235)
Job Function
Quality Control
Requisition ID
1805637889W

Title: CIB QR - Risk - Quantitative Research, Equity Finance, Associate
Job_Description:
About J.P. Morgan
J.P. Morgan is one of the most respected financial institutions in the world which is why we can offer you an outstanding career. We have been doing first-class business in a first-class way for more than 200 years. Throughout our history, we have played a leading role in helping companies grow and markets develop. Globally we work together to deliver the best solutions and advice to meet our clients needs, anywhere in the world. We operate in more than 100 countries, and hold global leadership positions in each of our businesses. We have an exceptional team of employees who work hard to do the right thing for our clients, shareholders and the firm every day.
Equity Finance & Delta 1 Quantitative Research
Quantitative Research (QR) at J.P. Morgan is an expert quantitative modeling group partnering with traders, marketers, and risk managers across all products and regions, with presence in Beijing, New York, London, Houston, Singapore, Hong Kong, Tokyo, Sydney and Sao Paulo.
J.P. Morgan Equity Finance & Delta 1 is looking for a strong quant to join their team in Hong Kong to develop and maintain sophisticated mathematical models, cutting-edge methodologies and infrastructure to improve the pricing & risk of their products.
Responsibilities
Work with the Equity Finance & Delta 1 desks, as well as technology and risk teams, to improve their risk & pricing workflow and implemented sophisticated tools & analytics accordingly. This requires enhancements to existing pricing models as much as the development of new models. A strong technology team will work alongside the quant team.

Inventory & Collateral Optimization
Optimization of collateral and inventory under various constraints arising from regulatory, contractual, capital, etc. requirements on one hand and expected duration, internal opportunities, etc. on the other
Devise solutions for improving the overall stability of our collateral and its respective uses
Develop mathematical models to project our inventory demand trends
Maintain adequate control functionality

Risk & Pricing
Develop & enhance pricing models for valuing Delta 1 products
Improve the risk & pricing workflow for the desk
Develop software frameworks for analytics and their delivery to systems and applications
Provide day-to-day pricing support for the Delta 1 business



Qualifications
Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in math, sciences, engineering or computer science
Exceptional analytical, quantitative and problem-solving skills
Mastery of advanced mathematics arising in financial modeling (i.e. stochastic calculus, numerical analysis, probability theory, optimization / regression)
Strong software design and development skills, particularly in Python and C++
Financial knowledge of delta 1, equity derivatives, inventory management is a plus
Complete online application, and submit your CV at JobConnect

Title: Head of Data Science
Job_Description:
The Head of Data Science plays a leadership position in the data science department and is responsible for overseeing activities of the junior data science team ensuring proper execution of duties and alignment with LYNK's overall vision.

This role is global, and the Head will be required to manage remote teams.

Why LYNK?
LYNK is a VC-backed, product-driven startup working with leading institutional clients, top level experts and thought leaders globally
We operate in a high-octane environment where our people think about the big picture and always strive to "make it happen"
Our team, spread across four countries today (and growing!), is multinational, multilingual and multicultural. Our clients have likened us to a mini United Nations.
You will be constantly challenged with new problems to solve every day.
We are here to realize big dreams and have a firm belief in our core mission - to democratize access to knowledge.
What You'll Do:
Create new data sciences capabilities for the business to enable informed decision making, by envisioning and executing strategies that will influence improvement of the business's performance
Proactively works with various departmental heads across the business in order to provide advanced analytic data modeling systems.
Designs and launches innovative and complex analytic models, utilizing a blend of contemporary and traditional data mining techniques, which is applied to both structured and unstructured data sets.
Requirements

What Expertise You'll Add To The Team:

Leadership:
Lead innovation within the business and, as such, defines how the business creates additional value through the utilization of its data assets and analytics.
Consistently identifying and monitoring key business risks and realizing the data needs of the business.
Manage the data science teams and oversees all activities ensuring alignment with departmental and business-wide vision and strategies.
Drive education and evangelization of data sciences throughout the business by communicating the vision and use cases of advanced analytics.
Manage the business's external data and analytics partners and plays a leading role in the development and design of the departmental vision, capabilities, infrastructure, and quarterly/annual roadmap for the launch of data sciences capabilities.
Build the business's data science talent needs through role definition, recruitment, and development of a team of data scientists that will jointly move the business's agenda.
Strategy:
Continuously improving the business's data analysis model, creating industry-leading performance through the leveraging of new and creative data-sources, and employing the latest in machine learning in the department.
Scopes, designs, and implements machine-learning models to support the business's numerous initiatives and programs with a view of achieving overall objectives and targets.
Match and optimise algorithms that are fundamental to the business's products/services identifying better matches that will ultimately improve the experience
Analytics:
Drive experimental data modeling designs within the business, and constantly run A/B tests in order to evaluate changes in the business's product/services.
Track the business's performance against data analysis model and monitor trends in key business KPIs, providing valuable insights to relevant departments for overall business performance improvement.
Draft regular reports on departmental performance and presenting recommended models and departmental strategies
A good understanding of NLP
Knowledge:
Maintain a deep understanding the business's marketplace dynamics
Take initiative and conducts exploratory data analyses and experimental designs
Help the business to better understand trends and behavior within these markets and settle on the most suitable strategies to drive success and achievements of goals and targets.
Bonus Attributes:
Strong passion for business and enthusiastic about taking part in shaping LYNK's growth
Eager to play a critical role in the success of a fast growing startup
Track record of excelling in small teams
Team players who thrive in uncertainty and like to "make things happen"!
Benefits

What We Commit To You
Competitive remuneration package in a rapidly-expanding startup
Work in a collaborative, co-creation hub in the heart of the city - with amazing facilities
Comprehensive medical insurance coverage, including dental
Generous leave policy, including a 'work remote policy'
The opportunity to travel and work around the globe with our international clients and growing number of offices (Hong Kong, Singapore, Mumbai, New York City)
The opportunity to be a part of something impactful
Visit http://lynk.global for more info.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Job_Description:
Environment
SG CIB is the Corporate and Investment Banking arm of the Societe Generale Group. Present in over 50 countries across Europe, the Americas and Asia. SG CIB provides corporate, financial institutions, investors and public sector clients with value-added integrated financial solutions.

Summary

Quantitative equity analyst in HK providing support and light development to local team and improving Asian sensibility of the global Quant team.

Mission

Main Responsibilities
As a Quantitative Analyst, your role is to provide quantitative insight and tools to the trading desks. You will join the global R&D team, which holds responsibility for providing pricing and risk -management tools globally for the bank. As a member of the local team, you will focus on Asia topics and more specifically on Asian semi vanilla products at first, before working on more exotic products. Using your statistics and finance expertise, you will understand the trading problematic and work on the internal pricing library to respond to those needs. We are looking for outstanding analysts with strong educational backgrounds and great theoretical modelling knowledge and skills. You will preferably be a graduate in Mathematics or Statistics and have fluency in English, with good programming skills.

Excellent project management skills

Title: Engineering - LCA Technology - LCA Technology - Data Engineer - Vice President
Job_Description:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB

What We DoAt Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don't just make things - we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.Who We Look ForGoldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. The candidate is responsible for design, development, deployment and support of products and platforms that leverage big data technologies and enable large scale event processing where events are inspected by machine learning and statistical policy based models. Successful candidate will join a team of talented and motivated developers working on strategic and highly visible projects within the firm. HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL * Play an key role in architecting the Compliance Big Data Platform to handle storage of very large datasets, design pipelines, and business metrics to scale with growing trading volumes * Build disruptive solutions using cutting edge technologies with measurable commercial outcomes * Develop technical specifications, high level/detailed design, testing strategies, and implementation plans from business requirements * Manage end-to-end systems development cycle from requirements analysis, coding, testing, UAT and maintenance

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS

HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL* Work in a fast paced environmentSKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR* JAVA, Python, RDBMS* SQL* Big Data Visualization ToolsPreferred Qualifications

Title: Assistant Retail Risk Analytics Manager - Global Risk
Job_Description:
If youre looking for further opportunities to develop your career, take the next step in fulfiling your potential right here at HSBC.

Global Risk is a thriving and expert risk management function supporting HSBC globally with all aspects of risk management. The team actively manages a varied and dynamic range of risk types, including security, fraud, information security, contingency, geopolitical, operational, credit, pension, insurance, financial crime and regulatory compliance, market and reputation risks. All parts of the Global Risk team use their skills, insight and integrity to handle established threats and those they see emerging, acting to protect and enable HSBC to deliver sustainable growth.

We are currently seeking a high caliber professional to join our team as Assistant Retail Risk Analytics Manager.

In this role, you will
Strong understanding of financial industry and knowledge of programming language like Statistical Analysis System.
Support data management projects and or Business intelligence needs.
Create and execute moderate to highly complex programs with organized structures and proper documentation
Diagnose and resolve moderate to complex issues and improve the efficiency of processes and programs
Manage delivery within agreed timelines and as per agreed quality standards.
Expertise and endorsement is required from colleagues in Risk, Product, Finance, and various analytics functions at country, regional, and global levels.
Methodology and execution governance processes are subject to scrutiny and modification by internal operational risk control teams including Independent Model Review and Internal Audit.
Demonstrate strong project management abilities in delivering large and complex projects.
To be successful in this role, you should meet the following requirements
University degree or post graduate qualification with a relevant quantitative content
Good work experience in risk modelling and management, credit cycle management and data analytics in retail banking environment
Knowledge and understanding in one or more of the below areas preferred, such as Basel, International Financial Reporting Standard 9, Stress Testing Model Development, Model Monitoring, Implementation and Execution Acquisition and Behavioral Risk, Scorecard Model Development, Business Strategy Development and Monitoring Loss Forecasting and Provisioning Management Information, automation and streamlining of work process
Strong experience in data analysis using relevant software packages, for example Statistical Analysis System, Excel, Visual Basic for Applications, SQL.
Demonstrate strong problem solving and project management skills
The ability to communicate with a various range of stakeholders including technical and non technical staff
For further details and application information please visit our career site, search under reference number 0000AN90

Youll achieve more when you join HSBC.

Title: APAC - HKG - Citi Research - Quantitative Research Associate
Job_Description:
Primary Location: Hong Kong SAR of PRC,Hong Kong,Hong Kong
Education: Bachelor's Degree
Job Function: Research
Schedule: Full-time
Shift: Day Job
Employee Status: Regular
Travel Time: No
Job ID: 18020301
Description

Job Purpose:
To assist senior analysts in the production of quantitative research in the Asian Equities market.
Job Background/context:
Citi Research is a highly respected for its thought leadership, differentiated analysis and actionable investment recommendations. Offering both depth and breadth, we have more than 400 research analysts in more than 20 locations around the world. Citi Investment Research covers more than 3500 companies, representing over 90 percent of the market capitalization of the major global indices, and provides macro and quantitative analysis of global markets and sector trends. Combined with Citi's exceptional sales and trading capabilities, the core focus of the group is to help investing clients make informed decisions by providing value-added, independent, insightful analysis.
In the Asia Pacific region, Research covers more than 1400 stocks and has a research presence in a number of markets, namely the Hong Kong, Singapore, Japan, Australia, Korea, Taiwan, India, and more.
Key Responsibilities:
Assisting senior analysts in the production of new and periodic research papers/documents
Collaboration with other analysts in developing new research
Development and Maintenance of quantitative models and databases
Maintaining and developing marketing materials
Other ad hoc tasks or projects
The role would be expected to develop into a quantitative analyst role with direct responsibility for research ideas and client coverage.
Qualifications

Knowledge/Experience:
Relevant industry experience (but not essential).
Strong quantitative background with exceptional analytical detail.
Knowledge of statistical packages such as R, other programming languages such as VBA, and database querying such as SQL.
Bachelors (Honours) or MSc/PhD degree(s)
Education should be in the field of finance, statistics, engineering, mathematics, physics or econometrics
Proven independent research ability together with considerable scientific computing experience (possibly gained through academia).
Excellent verbal skills including delivering presentations and writing papers in English. Fluency in Chinese is a strong plus.
Must be a team player and have ability to develop strong relationships with both internal and external clients.

Job_Description:
CompareAsiaGroup is Asia's leading financial management platform for banking, insurance, and telco products.

As a brand, we help consumer across Asia save time and make better choices with comprehensive, free and independent online comparison tools for personal loans, credit cards, insurance and other home services. Headquartered in Hong Kong, CompareAsiaGroup is active in a total of seven Asian markets including Hong Kong, Singapore, Taiwan, Indonesia, the Philippines, Malaysia and Thailand. The Group has established relationships with over 100 leading financial institutions and employs more than 150 people across its markets. CompareAsiaGroup is backed by leading investors including IFC, Goldman Sachs, Alibaba Entrepreneurs Fund, SBI Group, ACE & Company, H&Q Asia Pacific and Nova Founders Capital.

Join one of the fastest growing, young enterprises in Asia as we revolutionize the financial industry through technology.

Drive and manage on multiple projects from researching, planning, designing to final delivery.

Build reports, and visualization to present data, generate insights.

You should be:

Previous experience in working with data

Fast learner, enjoy solving problem from cutting edge technology

Good communication skills

Title: Enterprise Products - Implementation Specialist, Portfolio Analytics & Risk (Japanese speaker)
Job_Description:
Job Requisition Number:62648

The Product:

Our Portfolio & Risk Analytics solutions help financial professionals achieve their objectives by providing unmatched clarity into their portfolios performance, characteristics and risk. From one location, a series of powerful, integrated multi-asset tools deliver consistent insight, enabling our clients to build and execute differentiating investment strategies.

Whats the role?

We are seeking a motivated individual to join the fast-growing Bloomberg's Portfolio Analytics and Risk team, concentrating on desktop client integration. You will maintain the relationship from an integration perspective between Bloomberg, our customers and, third parties responsible for administering our customer's portfolio data.

With a consultative approach, you will be a great partner from the initial implementation phase throughout the course of a customer's relationship with Bloomberg. The end result will be a successful implementation of data into the Bloomberg terminal to be used for portfolio and risk analytics.

In this role, you will also interacts with multiple business areas and requires strong communication and time management / prioritization skills. Technical knowledge, especially in the areas of data transmission protocols, security considerations for data transmission and process automation is necessary for successful execution of this role. Financial market knowledge and the understanding of portfolio management will apply when working with the end Bloomberg terminal user.

The process of integration may differ markedly from client to client, so as an PORT integration specialist you will need to develop and execute implementation plans for each assigned customer and actively manage issues, coordinate issue resolution and raise issues as needed.

You'll need to have:
Fluency in Japanese & English a MUST
Experience/knowledge of processes involved with sending and sharing data.
Confirmed experience or knowledge of portfolio upload or similar integration experience.
Ability to develop and execute an implementation plan for each assigned customer.
Dedicatedly manage issues, coordinate issue resolution, and bring up issues as needed.
Strong project management skills.
Financial market and portfolio management knowledge.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Validated experience interacting with clients.
Positive relationship management skills.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Senior Consultant, Analytics
Job_Description:
This position is responsible for developing and
managing complex analytical solutions to address TransUnion internal and
external client needs and delivering business intelligence. This position integrates experience in

business concerns and applications to design, lead and develop complex

TransUnion serves. This position also
facilitates preparation and presentation of project proposals to
customers. Additionally, this position
provides subject matter expertise and technical support for new and existing
analytics products and serviced developed by TransUnion.

How you'll contribute:
Understand industry trends and the business at
the level needed to proactively identify areas of business opportunities and
analytical needs of customers. Provide quantitative
insight into emerging trends through analytical approach. Participate in the design and development of
new analytics products and solutions that address customer needs due to market
changes such as new trend and regulatory changes.

solutions, including regular monitor and review to ensure solution performance
and effectiveness. Communicate and sell
the strengths and nature of analytical solutions to internal and external

external client to gain deep understanding of business needs. Identify opportunities that TransUnion
analytical solutions add value.

internal and external customer needs

research conducted by internal or external parties, and integrate new methods and

customers in designing and conducting analytical projects. Demonstrate to internal and external

value-add opportunities for clients to help maintain and nurture strong revenue

Title: Talent Analytics
Job_Description:
What you'll be doing...

Role:

This position is primarily responsible for Workforce Data Analytics, Project Management, Metrics Creation and Reporting for Verizon Asia Pacific. This individual will be responsible for working across all workforce data elements and use their predictive analytics skills to analyze trends, identify insights, create and track action plans for "people processes" and strategies as they affect the business planning and implementation. This person will be responsible for project management of key HR initiatives including, but not limited to Workforce Planning, Career Progression, Performance Management, Leadership Development, Recognition Programs etc. This role will also be responsible for supporting the HR Business Partner team in providing the necessary data to drive decisions, consolidate talent data provided by the HR team and track talent data monthly.

Responsibilities:
Provide management support to the Human Resource function in the areas of people metrics, reporting, and advanced and predictive analytics.
Facilitates the consolidation of various data requests and/or HR initiatives.
Utilize technology and analytical tools to develop and analyze enterprise-wide people and other cross-functional data as needed.
Create, maintain, and ensure quality assurance of key human resources data sets, reports, and metrics through scorecards/dashboards
Analyze and monitor workforce data including staffing, turnover and performance. Work with HRBP teams to design and implement strategic action plans as warranted to drive business results.
Identifies insights that can be used to tailor employee engagement across the international business units.
Enhances the HR operational procedures, systems and principles in the areas of information flow and management, business processes and enhanced Project and Sr. Leader reporting.
Leads/manages special/strategic projects and presentations
Contributes to the implementation and roll out of critical ongoing processes and new projects to ensure Company compliance and progress across initiatives.
Collaborate with subject matter experts across the HR service areas (learning and development, staffing, talent management, diversity, compliance) to promote data governance and stewardship, and to improve overall strategic and operational performance and insight.

What we're looking for...

Essential Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in a technical, Human Resources, or business discipline.
6+ years of relevant work experience.
Proven Statistical and Data Analytics skills and experience
Strong communication skills and ability to creative a meaningful narrative driven by data
Experience with ADVANCED Microsoft PowerPoint & Microsoft Excel, formula building, pivot tables, graphing and charting.
Experience with writing queries, investigating results, identifying subtle patterns and associations and predictions in data, refining output, documenting findings, and packaging findings into meaningful summaries and recommendations.
Experience with Project Management and Change Management.
Proficiency in the use of reporting and query tools such as COGNOS / PeopleSoft
Preferred/Desired requirements:
Master's preferred or equivalent experience.
Previous HR / business operations experience preferred.
Experience with Tableau Visualization Tool a plus.
Familiarity with statistics and statistical methodologies/techniques.
Proficiency with querying tools and technologies such as SQL or other Query languages.
When you join Verizon...

You'll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America's fastest and most reliable network, we're leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we're about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon.

Title: 2018 Financial Products Analytics & Sales - (English/Cantonese/Mandarin Speaker)
Job_Description:
Job Requisition Number:59733

Bloomberg, the global business and financial information and news leader, gives influential decision makers a critical edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas. The company's strength - delivering data, news and analytics through innovative technology, quickly and accurately - is at the core of the Bloomberg Professional service, which provides real time financial information to more than 315,000 subscribers globally.

What's the role?

Are you passionate about the financial markets and excited by the prospect of creating customized solutions for the world's leading financial professionals? If so, join our comprehensive training program for Analytics Representatives in our Sales and Analytics group, a key part of our Financial Products business.

Analytics Representatives are integral to the Bloomberg Help Desk, taking questions from clients who use our state-of-the-art Bloomberg Terminal, also known as the Bloomberg Professional Service. Whether you are helping construct a relative comparison sheet for a research analyst, advising a portfolio manager on our risk management tools, or providing liquidity analysis solutions to a trader, you will continuously create innovative solutions for our clients.

What's Financial Products all about?

The Financial Products team provides analysis and data to Bloomberg clients. We deliver the company's core product, the legendary Bloomberg Professional Service, reaching millions of business professionals. Sales and Analytics work together as partners to provide value-added business solutions to our customers through the Bloomberg Professional Service.
Our team of Analytics Representatives delivers exceptional service through real-time chats, phone calls and face-to-face trainings to our customers on a daily basis. The team showcases basic and advanced Bloomberg solutions to meet our clients' specific workflow needs.
Our Terminal Sales team is responsible for demonstrating the advantages of our suite of solutions to both potential and existing clients. With a consultative approach, they identify our clients' needs and present Bloomberg solutions to help them make the best investment or trading decisions.
What to expect

When you join Analytics Team, you'll start off in a comprehensive training program designed to develop your cross asset and product knowledge so that you're prepared to interact with our clients on the Bloomberg Help Desk. Through daily interactions with key players in the financial industry, you will further enhance your skills in managing client relationships and problem solving.

Working as an Analytics Representative opens doors to other career opportunities within Bloomberg. The typical career path will lead to a Terminal Sales role. However, within Analytics, opportunities do exist in management and Advanced Specialist position. Advanced Specialists provide the highest level of product support, mentor colleagues and deliver training, working closely with Research & Development.

What we look for

We look for candidates who have earned a Bachelor's degree prior to joining us (expected to graduate in 2018) or who have relevant work experience.

We also require:
Ability to work well under pressure and to multi-task effectively
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Cantonese and/or Mandarin
Good team player
Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills
Immense interest in the financial markets
Proficient in Microsoft Excel
Travel could be required once in Sales
In addition, these skills and experiences can help distinguish you from other candidates for this role:
Coursework in finance, economics and/or business, although all majors are welcome
Experience using the Bloomberg Terminal
Desire and flexibility to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment
Experience in and enthusiasm for customer service
Proven ability to sell, with interest in pursuing a career in sales
Does this sound like you?

Apply today! If we think you're a match, we'll get in touch with you soon about next steps.

Title: (Senior) Machine Learning Engineer
Job_Description:
Why LYNK?
LYNK is a VC-backed, product-driven startup working with leading institutional clients, top level experts and thought leaders globally
We operate in a high-octane environment where our people think about the big picture and always strive to "make it happen"
Our team, spread across four countries today (and growing!), is multinational, multilingual and multicultural. Our clients have likened us to a mini United Nations.
You will be constantly challenged with new problems to solve every day.
We are here to realize big dreams and have a firm belief in our core mission - to democratize access to knowledge.
What You'll Do:
Build Data Pipelines that clean, transform and aggregate data into databases and adopt data warehouse solutions in AWS Redshift
Gather and process raw data at scale (including writing scripts, web scraping, calling APIs, write SQL queries, writing applications, etc.).
Develop data pipelines that unify various data sources into one cohesive platform for data access.
Define key operating metrics, develop related analyses, perform data modelling
Work on the optimization and development of channel performance
Implement the Analytics data stack using AWS EC2, S3 (distributed data lake), Elastic Map Reduce (computation cluster), Data Pipeline (job management in Spark (Scala) on Hadoop, using Avro and Parquet) and Redshift (columnar data warehouse), and Google Big Query and CloudStorage.
Requirements

What Expertise You'll Add To The Team:
Bachelor's Degree holder in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or equivalent experience
Experienced data engineering (4+ years of exp) with cloud technologies such as AWS Redshift, EMR and S3 (Less experienced candidate would be considered for Data Engineer)
Experienced with NoSQL databases (MongoDB or PostgresDB preferred)
Experienced in data extraction using SQL. ETL experience and expertise with Linux/Unix.
Experienced in debugging of complex systems for processing event based logs and user logs
Experienced in Database scalability techniques and Parallel ETL flows
Experienced in Computer Science (algorithm, operating systems etc.), Scripting language (Python, Perl etc.) and Functional Programming.
Bonus Attributes:
Strong passion for creative content curation and building brand awareness
Passion for business and enthusiastic about taking part in shaping LYNK's growth
Function well in a very fast-paced startup environment
Track record of excelling in small teams
Team players who thrive in uncertainty and like to "make things happen"!
Benefits

What We Commit To You
Competitive remuneration package in a rapidly-expanding startup
Work in a collaborative, co-creation hub in the heart of the city - with amazing facilities
Comprehensive medical insurance coverage, including dental
Generous leave policy, including a 'work remote policy'
The opportunity to travel and work around the globe with our international clients and growing number of offices (Hong Kong, Singapore, Mumbai, New York City)
The opportunity to be a part of something impactful
Visit http://lynk.global for more info.

Title: Director, Ratings Analytical Consumer Sector
Job_Description:
The Role: Director, Ratings Analytical Consumer Sector

The Location: Hong Kong

The Team: You will be part of a global and multicultural team.

The Impact: You will analyze original, non-routine and complex situations in a timely, orderly and insightful manner. Developing and maintaining a deep understanding of industry trends and issues.

Whats in it for you: This position acts as a senior member of rating committees as well as criteria committees.This position could also acts as chairperson of the rating committee in their area of expertise to assure the integrity of the ratings process. At this level, the incumbent will typically initiate, not just implement, identification and development of criteria, policy and analytical deliberations. The role will undertake credit analysis on companies and assume sector responsibility.

Responsibilities
Take direct responsibility as primary analyst over a small portfolio of sensitive, complex ratings analyzing pertinent information and data necessary for rating determination
Analytical oversight (surveillance requirement, analysis accuracy)
Criteria and thought leadership development. The director will be assigned to more complex credit ratings or deals and serve as an active member in supporting rating criteria committee and as a chair of the rating committees.
The director will assure that the analytical guidelines, procedures and policies established for ratings are adhered to by the analytical staff
Support business growth and franchise as a spokesperson (via media, seminars or our own media platform) for corporate and infrastructure analytics and will need to work with the CBM team in explaining analytics for outreach activities
External communication and outreach the director must develop effective relationships with issuers, intermediaries and investors
The director will lead the team producing thought leadership initiatives and commentaries
Functional and Business Knowledge
Has good knowledge of the overall global fixed income market and deep understanding of the corporate industry (ideally with a focus on consumer, retail, pharmaceutical and/or gaming sectors)
Remains current on research, trends and market conditions. Generates innovative ideas that provide new learnings for their business or teams
Understands how work of team impacts the business unit
Problem Solving
Solves complex, non-routine problems, using analytical judgement
Reviews analytic models created by others in the team for use internally
Interactions
Support business growth and franchise as a spokesperson (via media, seminars or our own media platform) for corporate and infrastructure analytics and will need to work with the CBM team in explaining analytics for outreach activities
External communication and outreach the director must develop effective relationships with issuers, intermediaries and investors.
The incumbent will coordinate with analysts, manager and staff at all levels of the organization to ensure smooth and efficient analytical work process/procedures
Typical Scope & Impact
To handle multi tasks or projects with tight timeline
To build or keep teams moral performance and at the same time to handle staff conflicts and non-performer
To meet regular surveillance timeliness needs and also to act on ad hoc or unexpected events and projects
To tackle heavy workload with limited resources
To solve common problem without cooperation or control over other teams (include non-analytical team)
What were looking for
Bachelor degree in finance, economic, business or accounting major
MBA or CFA Holder will be preferred
10-15 years of significant experience in financial services, credit or a relevant corporate sector experience strongly preferred
Knowledge: With strong analytical capability either strong credit analysis background or equity research background
Personal skills: Team player, good time management and strong communication skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
Has ability to mentor others
About S&P Global Ratings

S&P Global Ratings is the worlds leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.

S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or other legally protected categories, subject to applicable law.

Title: APAC - Markets Quantitative Analysis (MQA) - Quantitative Analyst - Associate
Job_Description:
Primary Location: Hong Kong SAR of PRC,Hong Kong,Hong Kong
Education: Bachelor's Degree
Job Function: Trading
Schedule: Full-time
Shift: Day Job
Employee Status: Regular
Travel Time: Yes, 10 % of the Time
Job ID: 17064800
Description

Responsibilities:
Research, development and maintenance of trading algorithms across Asia markets
Analyze individual Asia markets structure changes and re-optimize algorithm behavior (e.g., placement functionality, timing, etc.)
Work with external and internal clients (e.g., trading desks) to analyze performance and trading functionality
Write and maintain documentation of algorithm models, code, test cases and test results
Ensure the Algorithmic product is correctly deployed and administered. Including, but not limited to compliance and trading risk limits and client customizations
Participate in training of users and stakeholders and ensure all users have a minimum level of understanding of the Algorithmic platform
Qualifications
Bachelor or above degree qualification in a Mathematical, Finance or Computer based discipline
Relevant experience of equity products and trading concepts
Strong analytical skills and ability to analyze large amounts of data sets
IT skills and a proficiency in Java, KDB, q
Experience of the water-fall and/or iterative software lifecycles with a formal QA process
Understanding of risk and the application of risk management systems
Programming experience in Java Programming Language

Title: DIGITAL DATA ANALYST
Job_Description:
Responsibilities:
Drive performance tracking and evaluation of digital channels, including conversion and usage behavior tracking
A full revamp of all customer-facing webs/apps, covering the entire customer experience lifecycle
Content creation and planning, including SEO, SEM, Display, Programmatic, Social & Affiliate
Review, recruit, and build vendor & agency relationships
Requirements:
5+ years of experience in a Digital company, consultancy, vendor, or agency, ideally with international exposure.
Web/app tracking and analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics 360, Google Tag Management)
Strong commercial aptitude
Analytical and intellectually curious, with a strong sense for business and platform performance tracking metrics
Dynamic team player, with a strong sense of ownership and drive
Excellent interpersonal skills, a cross-functional influencer
If you would like to apply for this role or find out more, please contact Brenda Lee at (852) 2177-7577 or brenda.lee@greyanderson.com.

Title: Technician - Analytical
Job_Description:
Overview

Axalta is a leading global company focused solely on coatings and providing customers with innovative, colorful, beautiful and sustainable solutions. From light OEM vehicles, commercial vehicles and refinish applications to electric motors, buildings and pipelines, our coatings are designed to prevent corrosion, increase productivity and enable the materials we coat to last longer. With 150 years of experience in the coatings industry, the 13,000 people of Axalta continue to find ways to serve our more than 120,000 customers in 130 countries better every day with the finest coatings, application systems and technology. For more information visit axaltacoatingsystems.com and follow us @axalta on Twitter and on LinkedIn

Responsibilities

Principle Accountabilities:

Be good at the various paint surface and cross-section sampling, operation and maintenance of optical microscopy and microscopy-IR.

Be familiar with operation of routine analytical techniques, including but not limited to GPC, DSC, GC-FID, GC/MS and FTIR.

Ensuring reliable test results by qualitative and quantitative analysis with analytical instruments or equipment.

Record test procedure and lab activity, summarize test report on time.

Support chemist to complete daily lab work, establishment and validation of analytical methods.

Management of other lab work.

Good EHS sense.

Qualifications

Skill and Knowledge Required:

Junior college or above, major in analytical chemistry or related majors

1-3 years' analytical lab experience, familiar with automotive coating or coating analysis is plus

Strong ability in instrument operation and simple maintenance

Good English reading and writing ability

Team spirit, open-minded, communicative

Work under pressure and independently

High sense of responsibility

Willing to learn and good adaptability

Title: BI & Big Data Co-Prime Sales Rep
Job_Description:
Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to a large number of named accounts/non-named accounts/geographical territory (mainly Tier 3 accounts).

Primary job duty is to sell technology software products and related services in a defined territory. Identifies, qualifies and closes new opportunities. Manages accounts including the entire sales process from business development prospecting and specifications through contract negotiations, signing, and post-sales support. Leverages the Oracle sales model to maximize revenue growth and increase local market share. Builds and expands business partner revenue and self sufficiency.

Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. 8 years applicable experience including 7 years of technology sales experience. Ability to forecast, manage sales expenses, and successfully close new Oracle business. Business development, prospecting and presentation skills. Excellent communication skills and problem solving ability. Proven track record of exceeding sales objective and territory/account development. Experience as the focal point for clients for all sales and related issues. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle*s competitors. Travel may be needed. Bachelor degree or equivalent.

Experienced Professionals

New York | London | Hong Kong | Paris
