Title: Manager, Data Analytics
Job_Description:
About the opportunity

About Marketing

The Asia Pacific ex-Japan ("Asia") Marketing team leads strategy and best-in-class execution of regional and country-specific marketing programs. Objectives of these programs range from strengthening Fidelity's brand to generating sales in wholesale or institutional channels (B2B) and driving increased share of wallet from retail customers (B2C).

The Digital Marketing team, is comprised of individuals with backgrounds in search marketing, digital advertising, social media, multi-media content creation, CRM and data analytics.

Purpose of your role

This role will be responsible for analysing digital adverting and web traffic data to identify trends and patterns in media performance, site performance and customer behavior by using different web analytics tool (Google Analytics, Adobe, etc.). You will need to design, create and analyze daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly dashboard and reports. You will also need to collect and consolidate data, identify opportunities for enhanced reporting, and deep dive analysis.

You are curious, creative and proactive in identifying opportunities and asking big questions. As a part of our customer-centric organization, you have a point of view, and are unafraid to challenge the status quo. You have the analytical skills and business understanding to serve as trusted quantitative advisor and executional ally to the digital marketing team and wider marketing department.

About you

Key Responsibilities
Oversees the day-to-day operations and long-term vision of digital marketing measurement related to overall Marketing strategy and objectives
Leads the analytical roadmap and knowledge plan of digital marketing and the advancement of analytical capabilities and reporting
You put yourself into the customer shoes, seeking to understand customer profiles and their needs in order to inform engagement and retention strategies
Responsible for the advancement (and as natural operation process) of test and learn measurement of the online customer journey from first ad impression, to advertising click, to website interaction to conversion and business impact
Responsible for the online conversion funnel optimization, including A/B testing strategies, performance analysis and enhancement implementation
Assess campaign attribution and cross-channel activity to optimize marketing mix and ROAS.
Create and distribute daily, weekly, monthly, seasonal and annual performance, dashboards and ad-hoc deep-dive reports.
Technical lead for site tagging, QA and debugging, platform migrations and 3rd Party Vendors.
Champions efforts to improve tools, methods, best practices, and resources in the Analytics area
Acts as a liaison to other analytics professionals within the global FIL organization
Experience and Qualifications Required
Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, or a related field
Proven analytical and quantitative skills, ability to use hard data and metrics to support business concepts
Strong project management skills with meticulous attention to detail
High skill level with Google/Universal Analytics , Adobe Analytics and multi-variate testing tools
Working SQL writing skills and solid experience with Excel and working with databases
BI software (Microstrategy, Tableau) as well as statistical packages (R, SAS, Python)
Familiarity with data infrastructure and instrumentation, tagging/tracking data, and report building
About Fidelity International

Fidelity International offers world class investment solutions and retirement expertise. As a privately owned, independent company, investment is our only business. We are driven by the needs of our clients, not by shareholders. Our vision is to deliver innovative client solutions for a better future.

Our people are passionate, engaged, smart and curious, and we give them the independence and the confidence to make a difference. While we take pride in the excellence of our investment solutions and client service, we know we can always do better. We are honest, respectful and make tough calls, challenging the status quo to achieve better outcomes through innovation. Above all else, we always put our clients first.

Find out more about what we do, our history, and how you could be part of our future at:

www.fidelityrecruitment.com/about-us

Applying to this Job Role: Please note you are only required to upload your CV/Resume to the application screen.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Job_Description:
General information
Entity

Credit Agricole CIB is the Corporate and Investment Banking arm of the Credit Agricole Group, the world's ndeg13 bank measured by Tier One Capital (The Banker, July 2017)
Credit Agricole CIB offers its clients a large range of products and services in capital markets, investment banking, structured finance and corporate banking.
The Corporate and Investment Bank is structured around six major divisions:
Client Coverage & International Network,
International Trade & Transaction Banking,
Global Investment Banking,
Structured Finance,
Fixed Income Markets,
Debt Optimisation and Distribution.
The Bank provides support to clients in large international markets through its network with a presence in major countries in Europe, America, Asia Pacific and the Middle East.

Reference number

2017-26037

Publication date

23/03/2018

Job description
Business type

Corporate & Investment Banking

Contract type

VIE Programme

Term (in months)

12

Expected start date

01/05/2018

Job summary
In CACIB, the Quantitative Research (QR) team is present in Paris, London, New York and Hong Kong. Its main mission is to define and develop models and methods used by the trading to price and hedge derivatives products.

In Hong Kong, the quantitative research aims to:
support/train the local trading on all models/methods developed by the QR team ;
contribute to studies, implementation and tests of models in coordination with the QR team.
Your will contribute to the missions of the QR team in Hong Kong mentioned previously through:
Update, development of tools / pricers for the linear desks ;
Theoretical studies, model tests and developments for the non linear desks.
The VIE contract in short:
According Business France's eligibility conditions, the Volontariat International en Entreprise (VIE) is an assignment in a French company operating overseas for professionals between the age of 18 and 28 who are European Union nationals.

! IMPORTANT !
To apply, you need to meet the conditions mentioned above. If not, your application will not be selected.
If you are eligible, join your CV and a cover letter in English - and mention: your age and nationality.
For further information about the eligibility conditions to this programme, we invite you to go to Business France website: www.civiweb.com.

Job location
Geographical area

Asia, Hong Kong

City
HONG KONG

Candidate criteria
Minimal education level

Postgraduate degree - MA/MSc/PhD/Doctorate or equivalent

Academic qualification / Speciality

Academic background : University or Engineering School.

Speciality in Financial Mathematics or Financial Engineering.

Level of minimal experience

0-2 years

Required skills

Hard Skills:
Strong academic background in financial mathematics ;
Programming skills (C++).
Soft skills:
Strong communication and interpersonal skill ;
Motivated;
Rigorous ;
Team-oriented.

Technical skills required

Programming skills (C++)

Languages

Fluent in English

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Job_Description:
Data Analyst Intern (Immediate available is preferred)


Key Responsibilities
Assist in project development which aims at the growth and profitability of global advertising sales
Develop Advertising Sales dashboard using multiple data sources and tools such as Salesforce, Mixpanel, R, Data Studio, CMS and Klipfolio
Assist in preparing weekly and monthly reports to sales management
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Data science, statistics, computing mathematics
Knowledge of data mining is highly preferred. Experience in using SalesForce, SQL, SAS, Python and R or statistical modeling will be an advantage.
Work closely with analysts, Ad Ops and Sales Team
Comfortable with handling large volumes of complex data
Attention to detail, data-driven, and willing to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Excellent Excel skill is a must

Title: Junior Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Junior Data Analytics

The Junior Data Analyst will conduct operational reporting for clients to help make informed business decisions from large data sets. This is an entry level position and as such it is a suitable opportunity for fresh graduates to learn more about the nature of the business.

Key Duties and Responsibilities:
Run operational reports within our existing MS SQL Server environment to derive customer insights and solve business problems
Develop client presentations consisting of key findings and insights
Assess scope, provide accurate timelines, to ensure timely results to clients


Requirements:
Academic qualifications in a quantitative discipline
Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint basic skills required, with the aim to improve
Experience in VBA, SQL programming is a plus
Great command of verbal and written English
Personal Attributes
Articulate and self-motivated, with a team-oriented approach. Will work well under pressure. Must be able to quickly understand problems and be capable of providing pragmatic and workable solutions.
Required Skills

Required Experience

Title: Big Data Project Manager @ Terminal 1
Job_Description:
Terminal 1 is a technology firm that hires software builders to both recruit and build automated recruitment tools. Our recruiters are highly skilled software engineers, product designers, data scientists, accountants, and lawyers with strong technical skills and a network in their industry.

As a Big Data Project Manager, you will:
Manage project milestones, deliverables, tasks, schedules and project-related reporting requests.
Manage expectations of project stakeholders and project team members through Project Charter and regular, formal status update meetings.
Lead cross-functional, geographically dispersed, virtual project members.
Proactively manage risks, issues and tasks to break down barriers and get decisions made to ensure project is completed on time with high quality.
Organize communications and presentations related to project progress and risks for project stakeholders and executives.
Implement change management tools and processes in the projects.
Participate in internal projects that help scale the team; implement best practices; and, improve methodology.

Title: Business Analytics and Market Insights Senior Manager
Job_Description:
Job Description
Amgen is a values-based organization with a powerful sense of shared purpose toward our mission: to serve patients. We provide the capabilities, resources, and rewards of a global enterprise, while maintaining the entrepreneurialism and pioneering spirit that marked our early days as a biotechnology innovator. We encourage our team members to have fulfilling and meaningful careers through challenging assignments, career development, and valuable opportunities.

The Regional Commercial Excellence Senior Manager is based at Amgen's JAPAC regional headquarters in Hong Kong, and supports Amgen's JAPAC regional business including Japan, China, South East Asia, South Korea, Australia/New Zealand. This is a newly created role and will report to the Regional Director for Business Analytics and Information (BAI).

This role will:
Serve as the project manager for the long range planning process across the entire region, including consolidation of commercial drivers for key products; coordination / planning between our global / regional and country organizations
Provide business analysis on commercial trends of portfolio products and related therapeutic area products (including biosimilars)
Provide business development assessment to develop business case and determine commercial attractiveness of different partnership/business opportunities
Work with regional and local compliance teams to support researchers across the region in compliant execution of market research
Qualifications:
Related Master's degree & 5-6 years of related experience, OR
Related Bachelor's degree or & 7-8 years of related experience; including developing forecasting models, business analytics, and/or market analysis
At least 3 years in biotech / pharma or life sciences management consulting doing project portfolio management, strategic planning, decision sciences, and / or financial planning; proven project management skills with good attention to detail
Excellent analytical and presentation skills
Knowledge of advanced modeling and forecasting methods and tools
Demonstrated ability to apply decision analysis methods and financial valuation to product development and portfolio decisions
Experience in developing financial and / or resource forecasting models
Record of success in participation on and in supporting cross-functional teams; an ability to work collaboratively in a team-based environment
Fluency in English, both oral and written communications
Join Us

If you're seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you'll find it at Amgen.

Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses.

As an organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for people around the world, Amgen fosters an inclusive environment of diverse, ethical, committed and highly accomplished people who respect each other but compete intensely to win. Together, we live the Amgen values as we continue advancing science to serve patients.
.

.

Title: HR Analytics Specialist
Job_Description:
Environment

SG CIB is the Corporate and Investment Banking arm of the Societe Generale Group. Present in over 50 countries across Europe, the Americas and Asia. SG CIB provides corporate, financial institutions, investors and public sector clients with value-added integrated financial solutions.

Mission

The HR Analytics specialist is responsible for providing new and impactful dashboards and for developing HR analytics culture across Asia. He oversees SSC-HR reporting team in Bangalore and monitors the timely delivery of HR reports.

The HR Analytics specialist is in charge of refining the data governance framework to enhance the delivery of HR analytics. He / she also takes part in technical enhancements and digitalisation initiatives.

The HR Analytics specialist works closely with both Asia and France HR teams, with the regional Business Partners / COOs. He / she reports to the Head of HR Analytics for Asia.


Main Responsibilities

Provide new and impactful dashboards and develop an HR analytics culture
Implement new dashboards focusing on business relevant areas
Provide executive summaries with actionable insights for key dashboards
Work closely with HR Asia teams and with regional Business Partners / COOs to co-design and co-construct new dashboards
Conduct change management actions
Collect market intelligence
Be aware of HR data and other relevant analytics initiatives run internally
Connect regularly with Paris on the HRIS masterplan

Oversight management of HR Shared Services reporting team in Bangalore (2-3 staff)
Manage performance of SSC-HR reporting team
Ensure the quarterly delivery of the quarterly HR Key Indicators report
Reinforce framework around automated reports, ensure exhaustiveness and homogeneity of data produced
Define the governance between onsite and offshore teams

Refine the data governance framework to enhance the delivery of HR analytics
Contribute to the rollout of the global HR data governance and data quality program in Asia
Conduct annual user recertification and educate users on data protection
Enhance user guides to fit the needs of users in Asia
Continue data glossary policies and data quality monitoring
Improve access rights management of shared folders
Propose, perform and follow-up technical enhancements

Lead or participate in digitalisation and innovation projects in Asia

Profile
Strong organisational and analytical skills
Client focused with strong communication skills
Ability to supervise staff and to deliver results through Shared Services teams
Project management skills
Solution driven and ability to work autonomously
Process oriented, ability to challenge and simplify processes
Attention to detail and strong sense of operational control
Thinks outside the box to bring new ideas
Proficient in MS Office and BI tools
Fluent in English
Prior work experience in Human Resources

Title: Engineering - Equities Technology - Equities Technology Data Engineer (APAC) - Associate
Job_Description:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB

What We DoAt Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don't just make things - we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.Who We Look ForGoldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.

YOUR IMPACT

Equities Data Engineers are responsible for building big data solutions to store and analyze data for the Equities trading business. We work closely with other front office teams to define and develop the overall data strategy for the Equities Division.

As part of our team you will be involved in working on green field projects to derive business intelligence from our trading data warehouses. This involves working closely with the Equities trading, coverage and engineering teams to develop automated solutions for common business analytics, as well as performing ad-hoc analysis to answer key business questions in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS

Example responsibilities include:
Analysis of trading costs across APAC execution venues and impact of trading patterns
Analysis of trading volumes and market share trends across desks and clients
Generation of trading flow metrics and business intelligence reporting
Automation and integration of solutions with other firm systems
HOW WILL YOU FULFILL YOUR POTENTAIL
Solve complex business problems through application of technology and data science techniques
Opportunity for significant commercial impact through providing new business intelligence and informing business decisions
Help to scale rapidly growing businesses through technology and automation of data analytics
Develop deep knowledge of the Equities business and APAC market structure
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Strong technical, analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong programming experience in at least one OO/scripting language (e.g. Java, Python)
SQL and Database skills (e.g. Sybase, DB2)
Experience in software development, including a clear understanding of data structures, algorithms, software design and core programming concepts
Highly motivated, committed and capable of working to timelines
Strong team player and strong communicator
PREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field
Development experience with Big Data technologies, Data Analytics and Visualization
Prior experience working with front office trading systems and data warehouses
Interest in Equities trading and financial markets
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world. A(c) The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2018. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

Title: Senior Manager, Forensic Data Analytics, Consumer Banking Group and Wealth
Job_Description:
Develop and maintain data models to meet business needs.

Liaise with stakeholders to facilitate data requirement and logistics.

Consolidate and cleanse data from various data source for MIS and review.

Digest large amount of information and translate to meaningful conclusion and actions.

Deliver timely and quality MIS and share findings with management.

Streamline end-to-end execution to improve productivity and efficiency.

Conduct periodical review and health check on data and process to ensure accuracy of MIS.

Ensure operation processes are complied with guidelines and adhere to bank and regulatory standards and requirements.

Requirements

Degree or above with major in Mathematics, Statistics, Information Technology or related discipline

Minimum 3 years of relevant work experience in banking or financial industry

Proficiency in SAS, Excel and VBA.

Meticulous, detailed oriented and reliable

Good analytical and problem solving skill

Self-motivated and able to work independently

Good interpersonal and communication skill

Proficiency in spoken/writing skill in both English and Chinese

Title: APAC - HKG - Citi Research - Data Science Consultant
Job_Description:
Primary Location: Hong Kong SAR of PRC,Hong Kong,Hong Kong
Education: Bachelor's Degree
Job Function: Research
Schedule: Full-time
Shift: Day Job
Employee Status: Regular
Travel Time: Yes, 10 % of the Time
Job ID: 18019521
Description

Citi Research, in partnership with Investor Sales, is establishing a Data Science Consulting team to provide bespoke consulting services to Investor clients of Markets & Securities Services.
The Data Science Consultant role will be a key client facing position to directly work with Investor Clients on bespoke Data Science requests and projects. The role will support Investor Sales and Relationship Manager teams in the region and represent a range of Non-Markets Alternative Data products and services proposed for the new function.
Key Responsibilities
Meet with Investor Clients to discuss their plans and requests for bespoke Data Science projects
Introduce the range of Non-Markets Alternative Data Assets and Services on offer to Investor Clients and provide support to trial and test data sets for ongoing consumption
Shape project engagements for prioritization by regional Sales & Relationship Management leads.
Execute projects, from shaping and pricing, through design and execution, and then final delivery
Interact with the internal Research Innovation Lab to leverage core capabilities required to execute the projects
Interact with regional and global stakeholders to explain the new Data Science Consulting service and showcase examples of the project work being conducted
Represent the firm at industry conferences and external events, so that we establish a leading brand in the provision of Big Data Consulting services within the Investment Management industry
Qualifications

Key Skills
Experienced with Data Science techniques and toolsets, including core technologies such as Hadoop, Apache/Spark, MongoDB and others
Experience using Alternative Data such as unstructured data sourced from foot-traffic (cell-phone signals), satellite images, transaction data (credit cards, point-of-sale systems), aggregated financial flows (institutional), geo-spatial data sets, and others
Understanding of the Consultant role and experience shaping and executing projects for an external client
Demonstrated ability to execute and deliver high quality projects
Experience in investment management Research process, either fundamental or quantitative

Title: Senior Manager / Associate Director, Credit Analytics, General Account
Job_Description:
Responsibilities:

Credit Analytics Functions
Responsible for credit administration covering data update / review / checking on approved limits, utilization, post approval conditions monitoring, internal ratings, external ratings, excess management, country of risk, sector classification, and other MI reporting covering General Account ("GA") names
Assisting in monitoring credit submission across different investment desks and monitoring any late submission
Providing the GA capacity report to various investment desks
Responding enquiries and limit checks by various investment desks
Tracking and monitoring latest news/events/developments related to the GA names
Preparing Quarterly Loan Review reports and Watchlist Account reports
Preparing in-country MI reports for different Asian countries
Updating the credit procedure manual(s) across different operating countries in Asia
Enhancing reporting capability and fulfil growing requirement for MI and/or regulatory purposes
Leading the Credit Analytics Team (based in Manila) in performing some of the above credit administration functions, and participating in CAT team performance evaluation on a regular basis
Supporting headoffice CRM / CCO for related credit policy implementation
Co-work with Asia Treasury with bank names especially for GA banks (or subsidiary bank of GA banks) for limit approval
Participating and taking minutes for credit calls, meetings, credit committees and other credit conference, if necessary
Taking lead or participate in any related projects in credit administration and credit database (initiated by Asia or head offices)
Knowledge/Skills/Competencies:
Bachelor degree in business administration or accounting and finance or related field
At least 5 years of related experience in credit administration and related credit MI reporting
Strong analytical, communication and interpersonal skills
Dynamic and good team player


About Manulife
Manulife Asset Management (MAM) is the asset management division of Manulife Financial Corporation. MAM's diversified group of companies and affiliates provides comprehensive asset management solutions for institutional investors, investment funds and individuals in key markets around the work. This investment expertise extends across a full range of asset classes including equities, fixed income, derivatives, and alternative investments such as oil & gas, real estates, timber, farmland, as well as asset allocation strategies. MAM has investment offices across multiple continents - Asia, North America and Europe. MAM has more than 100 years of experience managing portfolios for The Manufacturers Life Insurance Company, John Hancock Life Insurance Company, and other major clients and is a leading global investment management group.

Title: Summer Intern - Analytics Client Services Summer Analyst
Job_Description:
OVERVIEW:

Summer Interns, Global Equity Execution Broker - Hong Kong

ITG's Hong Kong Summer Intern Program: two positions (Analytics Client Services Summer Analyst and Trade Support Summer Analyst)

Build your future before you graduate by being part of ITG's 9-week paid internship! Picture yourself at ITG, a leading global execution and trade analytics research broker. As a Summer Intern, you'll have an opportunity to network with individuals at all levels of the organization and work on challenging projects that make an immediate contribution to our business. Envision yourself gaining exposure to all areas of our business and collaborating daily with high-caliber individuals in a team-oriented environment.

From investment decision through to settlement, ITG helps clients understand market trends, improve trading performance, mitigate market risk and navigate increasingly complex markets. ITG is headquartered in New York, with offices in North America, Europe and Asia Pacific. Join us, and get ready for an unforgettable experience!

WE'LL TRUST YOU TO:

Analytics Client Services Summer Analyst:

Join our cutting-edge Trading Analytics team and learn exactly why we're known as the industry leaders in Transaction Cost Analysis. At ITG, our Analytics team uses econometric models and our proprietary peer database to guide clients in understanding how their trading performance stacks up against their competitors and provides unique insights that help our clients achieve best execution.

If you are interested in analyzing data, solving problems, and managing client relationships on a daily basis, then this is a career opportunity you should not miss!

WHAT YOU BRING WITH YOU:
A desire to work directly with clients in a fast-paced, deadline and detail-oriented environment
Strong written and oral communication skills
Second language helpful (Japanese, Mandarin, Cantonese)
Self-starter with a problem solving mind-set
Demonstrated interest in Financial Markets
Demonstrated ability to work in a team-setting while maintaining high level of ownership
Exposure to data management systems such as SQL, VBA, R, Matlab, a plus, Unix / Linux
Excellent application and system problem-solving skills; must be detail-oriented
Open to December 2017 and May 2018 Graduates
YOU'RE JUST RIGHT FOR ITG IF YOU WANT:
A smaller team environment with 5 - 6 professionals
A great place for upward and geographic mobility
Direct exposure to the decision makers and senior leaders on all sides of the business
The energetic dynamism of financial markets
Teams that are passionate about continually learning, improving and raising the bar
A community that values hard work as well as work-life balance
A company that is committed to giving back to surrounding communities, from LA to Hong Kong and Sydney and the 11 locations in between

Title: Senior Manager, Business Planning & Sales Management, Business Analytics, Consumer Banking Group
Job_Description:
Prepare timely and relevant business performance MIS for management review

Provide market intelligence updates to facilitate decision making and strategic planning by management team

Work closely with product and sales channel in business planning and budgeting cycle

Participate in strategic planning projects and provide relevant MIS or analytical support

Requirements

4 - 5 years of experience in retail banking, preferably in business planning, finance or analytics

Degree holder in Business, Finance, Statistics or related studies

Sound knowledge in Consumer Banking products

Strong business sense and customer focus

Ability to analyze and interpret business and financial data

Good communication and interpersonal skill

Conversant with PC application including MS Excel, Powerpoint and Word

Knowledge in statistical tools such as SAS, SQL and VBA is preferred

Title: APAC - Markets Quantitative Analysis (MQA) - Quantitative Analyst - VP
Job_Description:
Primary Location: Hong Kong SAR of PRC,Hong Kong,Hong Kong
Education: Bachelor's Degree
Job Function: Trading

Title: Associate, Rating Analytical (Commodities Sector)
Job_Description:
JobDescription :
The Role: Associate, Rating Analytical (Commodities Sector)

The Location: Hong Kong

The Team / The Business: You will be part of a global and multicultural team.

The Impact: You will analyze original, non-routine and complex situations in a timely, orderly and insightful manner. Developing and maintaining a deep understanding of industry trends and issues.

The Career Opportunity: This is a great opportunity for experienced professionals within the financial industry to deepen its analytical skills and industry insights. You will act in an analytical position covering a portfolio of leading corporate issuers in the commodity sectors in the Great China region. As a primary analyst for credits in the corporate sectors, you will not only perform analytical work and write reports, but also demonstrate your analytical insight to internal and external audiences in an international working environment.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for managing a portfolio of credits
Attend meetings and interact with senior management of corporations to obtain information upon which to base credit rating decisions
Actively participate and be engaged in rating committees. Present recommendations and your rationale to the rating committee
Actively participate in regional and global analytical work groups to maintain and enhance our analytical industry expertise
Prepare a variety of materials suitable for publication (rating reports, press releases) to disseminate and explain our ratings on a timely basis
Prepare commentaries/ papers on areas of expertise for publication
Share knowledge/ participate in initiatives to improve group operations (through sharing analytical expertise, coaching to more junior staff, project work)
Cooperate with non-analytical staff to ensure that the process dimension of the analytical process is properly executed
Demonstrate service excellence and professionalism towards external and internal clients
What we're looking for:
Bachelor degree holder of Finance, Business Administration, or a related subject
Holder of CFA Designation is preferable
5 years of relevant work experience as a credit analyst, equity research or auditing, consulting experience in the commodity related sectors.
Strong network and understanding of the Commodities (chemicals, metals & mining) market in the Greater China region
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English and Mandarin
Solid analytical capability, team player and has good time management skills
Able to multi-task and meet projects with a tight time frame
Ability to work under tight deadlines in a fast-changing, global and regulated environment
Willingness to travel, sometimes at short notice
About S&P Global Ratings

S&P Global Ratings is the world's leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.

S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings

Title: Vice President / Assistant Vice President (Data Governance Lead), Data Management and Analytics
Job_Description:
Work with the Group Data Office to implement the latest Group Data Governance model and be responsible for data governance book of work for in-country Data Office.

Work with Data Owners and Data Stewards to implement Data Governance and establish data definitions, monitoring requirements, and gaining support for Governance - this will be very challenging as it will require a cultural shift in the organization.

Train, support and monitor Data Stewards, Data Owners and IT Application managers across the organization to strengthen the application of data management and quality requirements in business and IT.

Work with Data Stewards to Implement data quality program, facilitate issue remediation and manage escalated issues that have not been resolved to the business satisfaction.

Work with IT teams to make sure IT projects fulfill the defined data management requirements

Develop key metrics and reporting that include key messages, control and operational effectiveness, and overall status

Prepare presentations and materials for stakeholder reviews, project team meetings, Data Management Council, Data Governance Metrics Review

Requirements

Minimum 5 years of experience in data management / data governance covering data quality management and metrics, and business metadata management.

Experience in rolling out data governance / data aggregation frameworks like BCBS239 is an advantage.

Preferably possess knowledge of banking data (like customer information, products and transaction information) and data privacy, operations, and technology functions

Demonstrate track record of a high level of personal initiative and leadership, and of setting and achieving challenging goals.; Excellent management and delivery skills

Able to dive into details and abstract the detail for executive communication

Able to work effectively and build strong relationships with teams throughout the organization

Take accountability for completing deliverables and enjoys owning tasks and jumping in to deliver.

Independent, organized, self-motivated and a team player.

Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills, with good attention to detail.

Able to think through and outline work processes in a thoughtful and detailed manner

Able to prioritize and handle multiple tasks effectively and work in evolving / changeable environment.

Possesses excellent judgment, knows when to escalate complex issues to senior management or business partners with relevant expertise.

Knowledge and experience with data related technologies like Oracle DB, Teradata SQL and data visualization tools like Qlikview preferred.

Exposure in using enterprise architecture and data management tools like MEGA, Collibra, Protiviti etc. preferred.

Title: Director, Ratings Analytical – Consumer Sector
Job_Description:
JobDescription :
The Role: Director, Ratings Analytical - Consumer Sector

The Location: Hong Kong

The Team: You will be part of a global and multicultural team.

The Impact: You will analyze original, non-routine and complex situations in a timely, orderly and insightful manner. Developing and maintaining a deep understanding of industry trends and issues.

What's in it for you: This position acts as a senior member of rating committees as well as criteria committees.This position could also acts as chairperson of the rating committee in their area of expertise to assure the integrity of the ratings process. At this level, the incumbent will typically initiate, not just implement, identification and development of criteria, policy and analytical deliberations. The role will undertake credit analysis on companies and assume sector responsibility.

Responsibilities
Take direct responsibility as primary analyst over a small portfolio of sensitive, complex ratings analyzing pertinent information and data necessary for rating determination
Analytical oversight (surveillance requirement, analysis accuracy)
Criteria and thought leadership development. The director will be assigned to more complex credit ratings or deals and serve as an active member in supporting rating criteria committee and as a chair of the rating committees.
The director will assure that the analytical guidelines, procedures and policies established for ratings are adhered to by the analytical staff
Support business growth and franchise - as a spokesperson (via media, seminars or our own media platform) for corporate and infrastructure analytics and will need to work with the CBM team in explaining analytics for outreach activities
External communication and outreach - the director must develop effective relationships with issuers, intermediaries and investors
The director will lead the team producing thought leadership initiatives and commentaries
Functional and Business Knowledge
Has good knowledge of the overall global fixed income market and deep understanding of the corporate industry (ideally with a focus on consumer, retail, pharmaceutical and/or gaming sectors)
Remains current on research, trends and market conditions. Generates innovative ideas that provide new learnings for their business or teams
Understands how work of team impacts the business unit
Problem Solving
Solves complex, non-routine problems, using analytical judgement
Reviews analytic models created by others in the team for use internally
Interactions
Support business growth and franchise - as a spokesperson (via media, seminars or our own media platform) for corporate and infrastructure analytics and will need to work with the CBM team in explaining analytics for outreach activities
External communication and outreach - the director must develop effective relationships with issuers, intermediaries and investors.
The incumbent will coordinate with analysts, manager and staff at all levels of the organization to ensure smooth and efficient analytical work process/procedures
Typical Scope & Impact
To handle multi tasks or projects with tight timeline
To build or keep team's moral performance and at the same time to handle staff conflicts and non-performer
To meet regular surveillance timeliness needs and also to act on ad hoc or unexpected events and projects
To tackle heavy workload with limited resources
To solve common problem without cooperation or control over other teams (include non-analytical team)
What we're looking for
Bachelor degree in finance, economic, business or accounting major
MBA or CFA Holder will be preferred
10-15 years of significant experience in financial services, credit or a relevant corporate sector experience strongly preferred
Knowledge: With strong analytical capability - either strong credit analysis background or equity research background
Personal skills: Team player, good time management and strong communication skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
Has ability to mentor others

The Data Science Consultant role will be a key client facing position to directly work with Investor Clients on bespoke Data Science requests and projects. Meet with Investor Clients to discuss their plans and requests for bespoke Data Science projects

Experienced with Data Science techniques and toolsets, including core technologies such as Hadoop, Apache/Spark, MongoDB and others
Experience using Alternative Data such as unstructured data sourced from foot-traffic (cell-phone signals), satellite images, transaction data (credit cards, point-of-sale systems), aggregated financial flows (institutional), geo-spatial data sets, and others
Understanding of the Consultant role and experience shaping and executing projects for an external client
Demonstrated ability to execute and deliver high quality projects
Experience in investment management Research process, either fundamental or quantitative

Title: BIG DATA ARCHITECT
Job_Description:
Sorcerer's apprentice, you master Hadoop, Spark et Cassandra and you know how to implement them for the benefit of a higher calling to draw the quintessence of Data. Thanks to knowledge sharing, you keep enhancing your skills to become one day elected by your peers Master of data.

Your role on the project

Within exciting projects, you will advise and support our customers in the identification of the impact of Big Data on their information system. There, you will develop Proofs of Concept. tu developperas des Proofs of Concept. In a continuous improvement approach, you will implement new architecture and solution patterns. You will work towards the delivery of Big Data or Data Labs framework using Lean Startup models.

Your role at PALO IT

You will be invited to take part in R&D works done within our Practices. You will have the chance to assist or be a speaker at must-attend international IT conferences. You will have the opportunity to write articles for our Blog or specialized press. Genuine ambassador of PALO IT, you will present our offers and take and active role in the development of the company.

Your technical environment

# Big Data: Hadoop (HDFS, MapReduce, Hive, Pig, Storm, Flume), ElasticSearch, Spark, NoSQL (Cassandra, MongoDB, Redis, Riak, Neo4j).
WHY US ?

Palo IT is a learning company guided by the values of Agility and craftsmanship offering you multiple possibilities to express yourself and enhance your skills through :

# Our monthly BarCamps;
# Our R&D projects;
# Our Practices (Development, Architecture, Lean & Agile, Big Data);
# Our missions high added value missions in France and internationally that will make you discover new horizons;
# Our participation to and sponsoring of major technical events;
# And our parties parties = FUN !

Firmly focusing on international expansion, we have offices in France, Hong Kong and Singapore, meet us to continue this growth !
Your profile

Graduated from an Engineering School, with 5 to 15 years of experience on a similar position. You are passionate about new technologies and digital innovation. Agility doesn't have any secret for you: in an environment driven by Time-To-Market, you have good communication skills, are independent and able to make significant proposals.

Title: VP / AVP, Data Analyst, Treasury and Markets Business Management & Support
Job_Description:
In order to properly build out the Treasury & Markets (T&M) data analytics capability, there is a need to create a team with proper data science experience and skillset to assist in sourcing, compiling, designing and analyzing T&M's structured and unstructured data into a proper data model framework to facilitate targeting potential business opportunities, process inefficiencies and overall business trends.

Work together with Innovation Lead to partner across T&M teams to assess business needs and identify opportunities to apply data analytics

Assist in defining analytical strategy, including analytical approaches, data and technology requirements

Use appropriate machine-learning / statistical methods to develop advanced data analytics models to uncover irregular and hidden patterns and predict risk events under comprehensive scenarios

Ability to create effective data visualization of results to present key findings to senior management and/or other stakeholders with actionable recommendations

Assist in automating and deploying data analytics models in banking environment

Requirements

Advanced degree holder in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Applied Mathematics or related science / engineering fields

Has at least 4-6 years of relevant experience in Data Analysis, Data Science, Business Intelligence or other related fields, including a minimum 2 years' hands-on experience in developing machine learning models (preferred)

Hands-on experience in Python, R, SQL or other statistical program languages and/or experience in using commercial statistical analytics tools, e.g. SAS, SPSS

Experience with JavaScript libraries or other visualization tool is an advantage

Kaggle experience is a plus

Independent self-starter with ability to multitask

Expert problem solving skills, strong attention to detail, creative mindset and interest in data analytics

Project management skills with experience planning and coordinating full project lifecycle for data and research focused projects (VP)

Effective interpersonal and organizational skills

Good command of English, Mandarin a plus

Have a 'can-do' attitude

Title: Reporting and Analytics Advisor
Job_Description:
Reporting and Analytics AdvisorPosition Purpose

To manage the revenue retention (churn and price down), ensuring accuracy of reporting and allocation, and provide analytics for churn prevention. This role will also support other reporting and analytics functions as required.

Job Functions

Manage the data consolidation and cleansing required for churn warning on a quarterly and FY basis. Ensure the production of accurate churn and price decrease forecast and actual reports on a monthly, quarterly and FY basis. Track and record the churn mitigation, renewal and termination progress and status for complete churn forecast. Manage the process of churn reporting, associated enquiries and escalations. Provide suitably processed data to the commissions function by the required deadlines. Manage the analysis and reporting of actual churn and renewal price. Assist with churn budgeting and target setting. Contribute to review and analysis of churn warning, analysis and prevention. Contribute to BI (Business Intelligence) to generate report templates for on-going process improvements. Assist with the integration of acquired companies into the Equinix revenue retention process. Ad-hoc reporting and analysis tasks as required and general support to the Manager of Revenue Retention.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Excellent written and spoken communication skills. High competence in English is essential.
Bachelor's degree in business or other relevant area, and min 2 years of business experience
Basic experience with SFDC (Salesforce.com)
High level of expertise with MS-Excel and working knowledge of MS-Access.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to work effectively with sales management
Positive 'can-do' attitude to getting results and finding solutions to problems.
Collaborative working style - able to operate well in a team and demonstrate flexibility in supporting the team results.

Title: Assistant Manager Analytics - Data Governance
Job_Description:
Location: Hong Kong

Department: Digital
Reports to: Data Governance & QC Manager

This role will responsible for implementing a data governance - Data Registry tool and act as lead of enforcing usage of the Data Registry tool. He/she will assist to instill a good data governance practice in the team and provide support for mitigating data protection risk across the company. He/she will also support in the developing data governance strategy and ensure quality & data governance policies and processes are to uphold the security, quality and value of the analytics assets.

Key Responsibilities:
To assist in the implementation of the Data Registry system
Promote a data privacy protection culture in the organisation
Assist Data Governance & QC Manager to work with business streams to enforce Data Governance via using the Data Registry system
Promote ongoing engagement of data stewards and data domain owners within the data governance infrastructure
Facilitate the development and implementation of data quality standards, data protection standards and adoption requirements across the organisation
Ensure data access rules relate to both internal and external access are established and documentation are developed and maintained
Keep track on agreed data usage purpose and obtained consent
Establishing procedures to perform periodic review and validation of user access
Liaise with IT to implement quality metrics, ensuring accessibility and consistency of data and readiness of related analytics capabilities
Enforce data governance practices to uphold the value of the data access, within the company and external parties
Train data steward and end users on using the Data Registry system
Requirements:

Title: Reporting and Analytics Advisor
Job_Description:
Reporting and Analytics AdvisorPosition Purpose

To manage the revenue retention (churn and price down), ensuring accuracy of reporting and allocation, and provide analytics for churn prevention. This role will also support other reporting and analytics functions as required.

Job Functions

Manage the data consolidation and cleansing required for churn warning on a quarterly and FY basis. Ensure the production of accurate churn and price decrease forecast and actual reports on a monthly, quarterly and FY basis. Track and record the churn mitigation, renewal and termination progress and status for complete churn forecast. Manage the process of churn reporting, associated enquiries and escalations. Provide suitably processed data to the commissions function by the required deadlines. Manage the analysis and reporting of actual churn and renewal price. Assist with churn budgeting and target setting. Contribute to review and analysis of churn warning, analysis and prevention. Contribute to BI (Business Intelligence) to generate report templates for on-going process improvements. Assist with the integration of acquired companies into the Equinix revenue retention process. Ad-hoc reporting and analysis tasks as required and general support to the Manager of Revenue Retention.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Excellent written and spoken communication skills. High competence in English is essential.
Bachelor's degree in business or other relevant area, and min 2 years of business experience
Basic experience with SFDC (Salesforce.com)
High level of expertise with MS-Excel and working knowledge of MS-Access.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to work effectively with sales management
Positive 'can-do' attitude to getting results and finding solutions to problems.
Collaborative working style - able to operate well in a team and demonstrate flexibility in supporting the team results.

Title: Quantitative Research - M/F VIE
Job_Description:
Environment

Your environment
SG CIB is the Corporate and Investment Banking arm of the Societe Generale Group. Present in over 50 countries across Europe, the Americas and Asia. SG CIB provides corporate, financial institutions, investors and public sector clients with value-added integrated financial solutions.
At Societe Generale, you will be joining the Global Markets division (MARK) of SG Corporate and Investment Banking. MARK offers a cross-asset approach along all its offerings : Research, Investment & Risk Management Solutions, Execution and Prime Services to asset managers, pension funds, companies, private banks, insurance companies, hedge funds, family offices, sovereign funds and distributors worldwide.

As a Quantitative Researcher in the Asia QMM team (quantitative market-making), you will be trained by senior quants to research and test systematic trading strategies. You will learn how to apply your mathematical / statistical skills to this growing field of financial markets.

Mission
Your role

Your main responsibilities and missions will be :

Identify, record, clean and validate structured and unstructured datasets as a source of information
Research alphas: design, model and test predictive statistical models
Work on risk management, risk / reward optimization and risk constraints
Develop code of trading models to run backtests on statistical market-making strategies with holding horizons from intraday to weeks

The VIE assignment in a nutshell

This VIE in Hong Kong is to begin as soon as possible but you need to plan 3 months between your application date and the beginning of your VIE assignment. It will last 12 months.

The VIE is a specific contract, under Business France's eligibility criteria, opened to candidates under 28 and from the member states of the European Economic Space. For further information, please see www.civiweb.com.

Profile
Your profile

You are graduated with a Master degree from Engineering or Business School or University with a secialization in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or similar.

Prior experience in data-driven quantitative research will be an advantage.

You are fluent in English.

You are proficient in Microsoft Office application (Excel, powerpoint).

Object oriented languages (with a preference for C#) and Statistical / analytics programming languages (with a preference for R) are required.

Evolution
Your Career Path

You may have the opportunity to join Societe Generale group permanently after your VIE mission, according to opportunities, without going through the whole recruitment process again.

To facilitate the examination of your application by our English-speaking managers, we thank you for applying in English.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities.

HSBC Commercial Banking serves millions of businesses ranging from small, to large corporates, providing commercial customers with a full range of banking services including Global Trade and Receivables Finance, RMB solutions, multi-currency business accounts, payments and cash management, and wealth management and insurance, as well as a comprehensive range of financing solutions. The Location: Hong Kong

The Team / The Business: You will be part of a global and multicultural team.

The Impact: You will analyze original, non-routine and complex situations in a timely, orderly and insightful manner. Developing and maintaining a deep understanding of industry trends and issues.

Whats in it for you: This is a great opportunity for experienced professionals within the financial industry to deepen its analytical skills and industry insights. You will act in an analytical position covering a portfolio of leading corporate issuers in the Greater China region. As a primary analyst for credits in the corporate sectors, you will not only perform analytical work and write reports, but also demonstrate your analytical insight to internal and external audiences in an international working environment.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for managing a portfolio of credits
Attend meetings and interact with senior management of corporations to obtain information upon which to base credit rating decisions
Actively participate and be engaged in rating committees. Present recommendations and your rationale to the rating committee
Actively participate in regional and global analytical work groups to maintain and enhance our analytical industry expertise
Prepare a variety of materials suitable for publication (rating reports, press releases) to disseminate and explain our ratings on a timely basis
Prepare commentaries/ papers on areas of expertise for publication
Share knowledge/ participate in initiatives to improve group operations (through sharing analytical expertise, coaching to more junior staff, project work)

Bachelor degree holder of Finance, Business Administration, or a related subject
Holder of CFA Designation is preferable
5 years of relevant work experience as a credit analyst, equity research, auditing or consulting experience
Strong network and understanding of the property market in the Greater China region
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English and Mandarin
Solid analytical capability, team player and has good time management skills
Able to multitask and meet projects with a tight timeframe
Ability to work under tight deadlines in a fast-changing, global and regulated environment
Willingness to travel, sometimes at short notice
About S&P Global Ratings

S&P Global Ratings is the worlds leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.

S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings

In Asia Pacific, BNP Paribas is one of the best-positioned international financial institutions with an uninterrupted presence since 1860. It offers a wide range of financial services covering corporate & institutional banking, wealth management, asset management, insurance, as well as retail banking and consumer financing through strategic partnerships.

Worldwide, BNP Paribas has a presence in 74 countries with more than 190,000 employees. It has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. Asia Pacific is a key strategic region for BNP Paribas and it continues to develop its franchise in the region.

BNP Paribas offers you an exciting career opportunity in an international, challenging business environment characterized by high pace and diversity with focus on creating valuable relations with our customers. excluding partnerships

Title: Engineering - Finance and Risk Engineering - Capital Measurement & Analytic - Analyst/Associate
Job_Description:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB

WHAT WE DO

At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don't just make things - we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.

Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.

WHO WE LOOK FOR

Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.

YOUR IMPACT

You will be working alongside a team of engineers towards an infrastructure for the firm to be able to manage and deploy its capital effectively. You will be using latest technology trends including large databases, efficient code using modern languages and visualization tools to implement the firms' capital management process. The role will give you an opportunity to
Interface with the firm's federation and producing divisions, including Finance Controllers, Finance Risk and Securities Division Management teams to understand and develop our capital management calculations and analytics processes
Understand current capital regulatory regime and apply analytics to derive business decisions for utilization of capital
Work on understanding the problem of capital management and optimization and develop and deploy solutions
Define problem statements, and enjoy working in a dynamic environment with engineers trying new technologies and applying them to solve these problems.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS

OUR IMPACT

Capital Measurement & Analytic (CMA) engineers are responsible for designing and implementing solutions to calculate, report and analyze the firm's capital. In an evolving regulatory environment where trading activity is constrained by the associated capital requirement and forward-looking business strategies and decisions are informed by capital, it is critical to be able to perform:
Frequent and timely calculation of the firm's capital requirements
Full-attribution to the business / trading desks that consume that capital.
Full explanation of changes in capital required for a desks activities.
Evaluate the marginal contribution of any proposed transaction against the entire firm's inventory.
Predict the firm's capital in normal as well as stressed scenarios including CCAR.
The global CMA Team (US, UK, India and Hong Kong) develops and manages the calculators and analytical tools used to optimally commit firm's capital to activities on an ongoing basis and comply with capital regulations in various jurisdictions.

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Basic Qualifications
Excellent interpersonal/communication skills, both written and verbal
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Comfortable multi-tasking, managing multiple stakeholders and working as part of a dynamic, fast-paced team
Expertise in a programming language (JAVA/Scala/etc) & experience with relational databases
Excellent academic background in quantitative fields - Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Statistics
Preferred Qualifications
Knowledge of data analytics, principles of risk analysis and capital regulation (e.g. Basel3, COREP, CCAR, capital optimization) a plus
Technologies: Web/RESTful service development: HTML 5, JavaScript/React/AngularJS, JSON, Java/Scala, Tableau, Slang/Secdb
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

Title: C# Developer Quantitative Research Machine Learning Artificial Intelligence Big Data Python, Hadoop, Spark, Java Volatility Trading Credit Trading Algorithmic Trading Hedge Fund
Job_Description:
C# Developer - Quantitative Research - Machine Learning - Artificial Intelligence - Big Data - Python, Hadoop, Spark, Java - Volatility Trading - Credit Trading - Algorithmic Trading - Hedge Fund
[Description]

My client is a quantitative research laboratory that sits inside one of the world's leading hedge funds. They apply Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning methods on Big Data to optimize trading strategies / activities. For example, they intend to collect masses of data and develop algos to optimize PnL based on this data. Then, they will get the machines to make predictions on prices, rebalances, gamma hedges, etc.

They are building a team of developers and data scientists / quants in Hong Kong, and they are seeking an experienced Senior C# Developer to lead their development initiatives...

Role and Responsibilities

This developer would have 5-10 years of full-stack software development experience that is focused on scientific research or trading technology. They would be responsible for managing the software development for all projects undertaken. While this hire would have no management responsibility, he/she will access to resources of junior staff who will float between technology and research activities. He/she should be comfortable with working with Big Data as well as Real Time data.

Successful applicants will:

have excellent programming skills in C# as well as an array of scripting languages, including Python and R.
have good "full-stack" software development experience.
have experience in setting up and managing clusters in the cloud for distributed data storage and potentially computation.
have experience with Restful and Streaming API development.
have experience with Big Data, including data staging, curating, and cleaning data.
have experience with real time high frequency data.

Qualifications and Education Requirements

My client would prefer candidates with Masters degrees in computer science, although they will be flexible for the right person. Some background in finance and (in particular) algorithmic trading is a plus, but not necessary.

Preferred Skills

Expert coding skills in python and C#/Java/C++/C.
Expert in using Zmq, MessagePack, and other methods linked to performing PubSub, Request/Response etc sockets.
Good knowledge of Hadoop and Spark.
Expert in SQL, NoSQL and Time Series DB technologies.
Good experience working with data, from acquisition, to cleaning, to curation to storage and retrieval. Working with large datasets on the order of several TBs a plus.
Good experience with JavaScript, browser-based interface building with real time data, potentially websockets and so forth.
Strong project management skills.

[Country] Hong Kong
[Company] Research Laboratory
[Salary] Up to US$40,000
[Working Hours] Full-Time
[Contract] Permanent
[Categories] Hedge Funds / PE / Asset Management, Trading, Business Analysis / Intelligence / Data Scientist, Software Development
[Industries] null, null

Title: Data Analyst, Global Coverage Solutions (GCS)
Job_Description:
In Asia Pacific, BNP Paribas is one of the best-positioned international financial institutions with an uninterrupted presence since 1860. Currently with over 15,000 employees* and a presence in 14 markets, BNP Paribas provides corporates, institutional and private investors with product and service solutions tailored to their specific needs. It offers a wide range of financial services covering corporate & institutional banking, wealth management, asset management, insurance, as well as retail banking and consumer financing through strategic partnerships.

Worldwide, BNP Paribas has a presence in 74 countries with more than 190,000 employees. It has key positions in its three main activities: Domestic Markets and International Financial Services (whose retail-banking networks and financial services are covered by Retail Banking & Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking, which serves two client franchises: corporate clients and institutional investors. Asia Pacific is a key strategic region for BNP Paribas and it continues to develop its franchise in the region.

BNP Paribas offers you an exciting career opportunity in an international, challenging business environment characterized by high pace and diversity with focus on creating valuable relations with our customers. We offer a competitive salary & benefits package and also an excellent work environment where you're valued as part of our team!
excluding partnerships
Position Purpose

Data Analyst of JDMP will work under the guidance and control of the Head of Data Management Platform APAC - GCS and PM (JDMP) in order to contribute to the Data Management, Reporting and Analysis stream in the following pillars:
Data Management & Transformation
Data Infrastructure & Design
Automation of data feed and storage
Report Digitalization
Key Responsibilities

1. Data management and Transformation

a. Ensure data accuracy & controls
Conduct database administrative work (including access rights maintenance)
Periodical checks on client referential in the tools
Coordinate with responsible parties to ensure the update of referential figures
Coordinate with CIB Finance for the Client revenue data issues (data missing, feeding issue etc)
b. Data extraction and report preparation
Ensure monthly BAU reports are generated on time with proper data control
Manage data feeds within the production environment
Provide support to stakeholders on data extraction
c. CIB APAC Loan book & Client revenue budget
provide guidelines and instructions in relation to the Budget input, requirements and timelines
Upfront preparation process including review mappings and workflows, data preparation
Data management and transformation of Budget data as per stakeholder's requirement (coverage lines, country heads, top management)
Coordinate with CIB Client reporting team / provide necessary assistance for the Budget tool users (e.g. training, user manual, technical supports)
Promote / facilitate dialogue & ensure alignment between key contributors
Monitor the budget process to ensure complete submission of budget to APAC management
2. Data Infrastructure & Design
Identify opportunities to fine-tune and optimize database systems and applications
3. Automation of data feed and storage
Manage interconnection and Access rights to data from CIB Analytics Consulting, CIB Finance and all other internal/external suppliers
Data lake management - efficient storage of data, with good audit track
Ensure maximum automation of databases used in JDMP
4. Report digitalization
Propose and deploy digital solutions for internal reporting (e.g. Tableau)
Constantly improve user-friendliness of reports and digital tools


Ensure compliance with Bank's policies/procedures and regulatory requirements, in particular with regards to the KYC responsibilities and duties, as per relevant policies and procedures, and the summary of responsibilities list attached hereto.


Competencies (Technical / Behavioural)
Strong DBA experience in SQL/VBA
Strong ability in data mining and database management
Strong analytical and problem solving skill
Agile learning skills on latest tools / software on database management and reporting / visualization
Willing to learn and support new application modules and technologies
Creative, design oriented and open-minded

Title: ICG Markets - Prime Finance Quantitative Analyst –

Within the Equities and Prime Finance business, the Equity Financial Resource Management team is responsible for efficient secured funding of all equity collateral (across Prime, Delta One and Equities), optimization of scarce resources, FRM analytics and client returns. Experience in object-orientated programming and the architecture of trading platforms
Understanding of the Equities business essential and exposure to Delta One and Prime Finance a significant advantage
Excellent communication skills

Title: Associate, Rating Analytical (Insurance Ratings)
Job_Description:
JobDescription :
The Role: Associate, Rating Analytical (Insurance Ratings)

The Location: Hong Kong

The Impact: You will provide key stakeholders with our value-added "credit story" on insurance companies and markets through insightful opinions and strong analysis.

What's in it for you: You will have the opportunity to analyze a portfolio of insurance companies Asia. This position involves meeting with issuers and investors on analytical matters, assisting in resolving client needs, leading market education efforts, and taking the lead at external meetings related to credits.

Responsibilities:
Analyzing information and data for determining ratings on insurance companies and their debt issues
Making recommendations and presenting to rating committees
Drafting press releases, company-specific reports, and industry commentaries in a fast-paced environment with publication deadlines
Effectively communicating to clients Standard & Poor's methodology and procedures
Continuous monitoring of operating performance of rated companies, including reviews of public filings and private information supplied by issuers, and participation in client meetings
Meeting with issuers and investors on analytical matters and assisting in resolving clients' analytical needs
Contributing to Standard & Poor's global and regional analytical sectoral forums, and authoring related commentaries
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree. Actuarial background, advanced degree, or CFA charter is a plus
Minimum five years of experience in an analytical position. Working experience in the insurance industry is a plus
Good understanding of financial and capital markets, business environments, and relevant insurance regulations in China and Hong Kong
Chinese language skills, including Putonghua
Strong financial statement analysis skills and accounting knowledge
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
A demonstrated ability to give effective presentations to senior executives
A highly motivated team player who can work autonomously in a global, multi-cultural and fast pace environment
Ability to undertake rigorous analytical work and be proficient at writing analytical reports in English
About S&P Global Ratings

S&P Global Ratings is the world's leading provider of independent credit ratings. Our ratings are essential to driving growth, providing transparency and helping educate market participants so they can make decisions with confidence. We have more than 1 million credit ratings outstanding on government, corporate, financial sector and structured finance entities and securities. We offer an independent view of the market built on a unique combination of broad perspective and local insight. We provide our opinions and research about relative credit risk; market participants gain independent information to help support the growth of transparent, liquid debt markets worldwide.

S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/ratings
